title: An Under the Radar High Quality ETF
summary: The Fidelity Quality Factor ETF (FQAL) received a five-star rating from CFRA, outperforming its peers and the S&P 500 in 2021 despite its smaller asset size. The fund focuses on free cash flow and return on invested capital with a sector-neutral approach, and CFRA expects it to continue outperforming. Eight of its top-10 holdings are considered undervalued by CFRA analysts.

title: Hasbro Promotes Chris Cocks to CEO
summary: Hasbro has named Chris Cocks as its new CEO, succeeding the late Brian Goldner and interim CEO Rich Stoddart. Cocks, previously president and COO of Wizards of the Coast and digital gaming, will focus on evolving Hasbro’s brand blueprint strategy and generating growth. Eric Nyman has been appointed president and COO of Hasbro, while Stoddart will become chair of the board.

title: What Crypto-related ETFs Could Hit the US Market in 2022?
summary: The article discusses the potential for various crypto-related ETFs, particularly metaverse products, to launch in the US market in 2022, while the approval of spot bitcoin and ether futures products remains uncertain. Industry experts express apprehension about the immediate investability of metaverse ETFs due to potential crossover in holdings and a lack of pure-play names. There's also skepticism regarding the SEC's approval of a spot bitcoin ETF in 2022, with some analysts expecting an ether futures-based ETF to gain approval sooner.

title: Machine Customers Will Decide Who Gets Their Trillion-Dollar Business. Is It You?
summary: The article explores the rise of "machine customers" and their potential to drive a trillion-dollar business opportunity. It outlines how these nonhuman entities, ranging from bound to autonomous customers, make purchasing decisions differently from humans by being transparent, processing vast amounts of data, and prioritizing efficiency over emotional loyalty. Businesses must adapt their corporate strategy, sales, marketing, and data analytics to cater to this evolving market.

title: JVAL Stock Price | JPMorgan U.S. Value Factor ETF
summary: This article provides detailed information about the JPMorgan U.S. Value Factor ETF (JVAL), including its current stock price, trading exchange (NYSE), and comprehensive financial metrics such as dividend yield, expense ratio, and market capitalization. It also offers technical analysis insights and lists the ETF's top holdings, outlining its investment strategy as a value-focused equity fund targeting the U.S. market.

title: Oracle Corp. stock rises Monday, outperforms market
summary: Oracle Corp. (ORCL) stock increased by 2.02% to $89.28 on Monday, outperforming the broader market downturn where the S&P 500 Index and Dow Jones Industrial Average fell. This marks the stock's second consecutive day of gains, although it remains $17.06 short of its 52-week high. Oracle's performance was mixed compared to competitors like Microsoft, Adobe, and Salesforce.com, and trading volume exceeded its 50-day average.

title: Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies: Reimagining the patient journey in a digital era - Source
summary: Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies (JJMDC) and Microsoft have entered a multiyear collaboration to reimagine the patient journey in a digital era. Microsoft will become JJMDC’s preferred cloud provider for its digital surgery solutions, with the goal of using AI, machine learning, and data insights to improve patient outcomes, increase consistency in care, and enhance surgical performance. The partnership aims to connect medical devices, patient records, and hospital information systems through Azure to provide comprehensive patient views and predictive maintenance capabilities.

title: Palo Alto Networks Joins Microsoft 365 Networking Partner Program
summary: Palo Alto Networks announced its integration into the Microsoft 365 Networking Partner Program, aiming to provide secure and efficient connectivity for Microsoft 365 users through its Prisma Access service. This collaboration ensures an optimal user experience aligned with Microsoft's connectivity principles, particularly for hybrid workforces. Prisma Access offers a cloud-delivered security platform that meets Microsoft 365 requirements, enabling Zero Trust access and robust threat protection for enterprise customers.

title: Microsoft announces new research and technology to empower millions of frontline workers
summary: Microsoft has released new research and technology, including updates to Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Viva, aimed at empowering millions of frontline workers globally. The company saw 400% growth in monthly active Teams usage by frontline workers since March 2020, and the new features address challenges identified in a Work Trend Index report, such as communication gaps and the need for better training and technology integration. These developments aim to modernize workflows, enhance job performance, and improve workplace culture for the 2 billion frontline workers worldwide.

title: Microsoft to acquire Activision Blizzard to bring the joy and community of gaming to everyone, across every device
summary: Microsoft announced its plans to acquire Activision Blizzard, a major player in game development, to expand its gaming business across mobile, PC, console, and cloud platforms. This acquisition will make Microsoft the world's third-largest gaming company by revenue and include iconic franchises like “Warcraft,” “Diablo,” “Call of Duty,” and “Candy Crush,” aiming to accelerate the development of metaverse platforms. Satya Nadella emphasized the investment in world-class content, community, and cloud to create a safe, inclusive, and accessible gaming experience for all.

title: How to Invest in the Top 100 U.S. ESG Companies
summary: The article discusses the 2022 list of top 100 U.S. ESG companies compiled by Just Capital, highlighting major movements like Alphabet's rise and Meta's fall. It explains the methodology behind the rankings, which prioritize issues important to Americans, and introduces the Goldman Sachs JUST U.S. Large Cap Equity ETF (JUST) as a way to invest in companies demonstrating "just business behavior."

title: FedEx and Microsoft announce new cross-platform logistics solution for e-commerce
summary: FedEx and Microsoft are expanding their collaboration to introduce a new cross-platform "logistics as a service" solution for retailers, merchants, and brands. This offering will integrate FedEx network intelligence with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Intelligent Order Management to improve customer engagement, shipping options, and supply chain visibility. The initiative aims to help businesses better fulfill, ship, and service customer orders by leveraging AI and machine learning from the vast data generated by FedEx's daily operations.

title: Ministry of the Presidency and Microsoft sign collaboration agreement to improve protection and defense against cyberthreats
summary: The Ministry of the Presidency of the Dominican Republic and Microsoft Corporation have signed a collaboration agreement to enhance protection and defense against cyberthreats. This agreement makes the Dominican Republic the first Caribbean country and the only active Latin American country to join Microsoft's Government Security Program (GSP). The program provides access to Microsoft technology, security information, and facilitates collaboration between Microsoft and government cybersecurity experts.

title: Microsoft to Acquire Activision Blizzard for $68.7B, Becoming Third Largest Gaming Company
summary: Microsoft Corporation is set to acquire Activision Blizzard Inc. in a $68.7 billion cash deal, which will make Microsoft the third-largest gaming company globally. This acquisition will add major game franchises like Warcraft and Call of Duty to Microsoft's portfolio and integrate them into its Game Pass service, significantly expanding its presence in mobile, PC, console, and cloud gaming. The deal is expected to close in fiscal year 2023, pending regulatory approval.

title: Is chip giant Nvidia going to scrap its $40BN bid for Arm?
summary: Nvidia is reportedly preparing to abandon its $40 billion acquisition of Arm Ltd. due to fierce regulatory backlash and little progress in securing approvals. Regulators and customers, including the U.S. FTC, have expressed concerns that the deal would make Nvidia too powerful. SoftBank, Arm's current owner, is stepping up preparations for an Arm initial public offering as an alternative.

title: DISH Sets Data in Motion with Confluent, Unlocking the Power of the First 5G Smart Network™
summary: DISH Network Corporation is partnering with Confluent to leverage cloud-native data streaming with Apache Kafka for real-time analytics on its new smart 5G network. This collaboration, using AWS infrastructure, aims to create a central network nervous system, enabling DISH to deploy a scalable and elastic data architecture that enhances performance, streamlines dynamic behaviors, and provides game-changing real-time intelligence for DISH and its enterprise customers.

title: Gartner Recommends Organizations Confront Three Internal Labor Market Inequities to Retain Talent
summary: Gartner advises organizations to address three internal labor market inequities to improve employee retention amidst the ongoing "Great Resignation." These inequities—unequal awareness, access, and support—hinder employee agility and fair internal hiring processes. By leveraging technology to democratize awareness, opening access to opportunities, and encouraging manager support for mobility, companies can foster a more equitable environment, leading to higher performance and reduced turnover.

title: Reference design offers wireless docking over Wi-Fi 6E for PCs
summary: Synaptics Incorporated has introduced Gemini, a reference design that offers wireless docking over Wi-Fi 6E for PCs, claiming it's the world's first true Wi-Fi 6/6E wireless docking experience for laptops. This technology enables full dual-4K display capability and ultra-low latency, comparable to wired connections, and integrates hardware and software components like the BCM43752 Wi-Fi 6/6E radio and DL-1950 video interface IC. While initially focused on PC docking, Gemini's applications extend to tablets, gaming, and VR, with analyst Patrick Moorhead highlighting its potential to revolutionize connectivity in hybrid work environments.

title: Electronic Arts Names Chris Suh as Chief Financial Officer
summary: Electronic Arts Inc. (NASDAQ: EA) announced Chris Suh as its new Chief Financial Officer, effective March 1. Suh, previously Corporate Vice President and CFO of Microsoft's Cloud + AI group, will report to Chairman and CEO Andrew Wilson and oversee various financial functions. He replaces Blake Jorgensen, who is stepping down after nearly a decade.

title: Home Depot launches training program to support construction industry
summary: Home Depot has launched a free job-training program called "Path to Pro" to address the significant labor shortage in the construction industry. The program offers self-paced training focused on basic construction skills, job site safety, and soft skills, aiming to connect qualified candidates with potential employers through its "Path to Pro network." This initiative seeks to rebuild interest in construction careers and fill the labor gap with entry-level workers.

title: The Great Video Game Consolidation Is Just Beginning
summary: Sony Group Corp. is acquiring Bungie Inc., creator of Halo and Destiny, for $3.6 billion, signaling a growing consolidation in the video game industry. This acquisition follows other major deals, such as Microsoft's planned purchase of Activision Blizzard and Take-Two Interactive's deal for Zynga, suggesting a "feeding frenzy" as tech and entertainment companies seek talent for metaverse projects. The article predicts more such mergers to come.

title: Amazon and Microsoft led the world in corporate purchases of clean energy in 2021
summary: Amazon and Microsoft were global leaders in corporate clean energy power purchase agreements in 2021, with Amazon holding the top spot for the second consecutive year. Combined, the two tech giants procured 12.4 GW of wind and solar power, contributing significantly to a record-setting year for corporate carbon-free energy deals. Both companies are committed to achieving 100% renewable energy for their operations by 2025, with Microsoft aiming for 24/7 clean energy by 2030.

title: Alphabet brings big stock splits back to market
summary: Alphabet Inc. announced a 20-for-1 stock split, aiming to make its shares more accessible to small investors by reducing the per-share price. This move is also seen as a step towards potential inclusion in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which has historically been a barrier due to Alphabet's high stock price. The announcement led to a 10% jump in shares during premarket trading.

title: Alphabet eyes $2 trillion value after blowout results
summary: Alphabet Inc. is on the verge of joining Apple and Microsoft in the $2 trillion market valuation club after a strong quarterly report led to an over 8% surge in its shares. The company also announced a 20-to-1 stock split, aiming to make shares more accessible to retail investors. At least 20 brokerages raised their price targets on Alphabet's stock.

title: International Funds Stop Fresh Transactions. Is It a Worrying Sign?
summary: Mutual fund investors were surprised when fund houses stopped fresh transactions in schemes offering exposure to offshore equities. This industry-wide decision was prompted by the Indian mutual fund industry reaching its overall investment limit of USD 7 billion in offshore securities, set by the RBI in 2008. While many funds have temporarily suspended inflows into schemes with overseas exposure, certain overseas ETFs may still accept investments as they fall under a separate, unbreached limit.

title: PLDT and Microsoft seal partnership for Threat Intelligence sharing to combat rising Cybercrime in the Philippines
summary: PLDT Inc. and Microsoft have formed a strategic partnership through Microsoft's Cyber Threat Intelligence Program (CTIP) to enhance the Philippines' digital security against cyber threats. This collaboration provides PLDT with real-time access to Microsoft DCU's Azure-based cyber threat intelligence, enabling better identification and mitigation of cybercrime. Both companies aim to strengthen cybersecurity capabilities and protect over 70 million mobile and 3.7 million broadband customers in the country.

title: Xerox Acquires Powerland, Expanding IT Services Reach Across Canada
summary: Xerox Holdings Corp. has acquired Canadian IT services company Powerland in an all-cash deal to strengthen its IT services offerings in North America, with the aim of becoming a single provider for SMBs' IT and print needs across the region. Powerland, founded in 1985, will retain its name with the addition of "A Xerox Business Solutions Company" and its approximately 100 employees will join Xerox. This acquisition is part of Xerox's strategy to expand its IT services business, following other recent acquisitions in the space.

title: Samsung, Amdocs collaborate for private 5G at Howard University
summary: Amdocs and Samsung Electronics America have partnered to deploy a Citizens Broadband Radio Service (CBRS)-based private 5G network across Howard University’s campus in Washington D.C. This network aims to enhance digital learning, information access, security, and reliability for over 6,000 students, faculty, and residents. The deployment utilized Samsung RAN technology and Amdocs served as the lead systems integrator, designing and managing the network.

title: Microsoft’s Asenso Pilipinas Summit Gathers Government Leaders to Empower Stronger Digital Organizations across the Philippines – Microsoft News Center Philippines
summary: Microsoft recently held its 5th annual Asenso Pilipinas summit, bringing together nearly 3,000 public officials to discuss navigating change and building stronger digital organizations post-COVID-19. The event focused on empowering governments to engage citizens, modernize workplaces, and enhance services through technology, with keynotes and plenary sessions on hybrid work, hyper-connected government, AI, and end-to-end security. Microsoft also committed to investing $20 billion over five years to accelerate cybersecurity efforts globally.

title: Can A Vintage T. Rowe Price Fund Ride Rivian, Microsoft And Snap To The Moon?
summary: Portfolio manager Joe Fath is revitalizing the T. Rowe Price Growth Stock Fund, founded in 1950, by investing heavily in new tech companies and focusing on "disruptive change," contrasting with the fund's historical picks like IBM. Despite facing outflows to passive management, Fath's strategy involves concentrated bets in private companies like Rivian, and public tech giants such as Microsoft, achieving significant returns. He remains confident in these high-growth, high-volatility investments, believing their long-term growth profiles will ultimately reward shareholders.

title: Microsoft to potentially give up 30% commission on Xbox in wake of regulatory pressure
summary: Microsoft is considering revising its standard 30% commission on Xbox to a more flexible model due to increasing regulatory pressure, especially ahead of the Activision Blizzard acquisition. While the company has committed to several "open app store" principles for its PC store and some for Xbox, it still justifies the 30% cut by selling consoles at a loss. Microsoft states it aims to evolve its business model to center on players and adaptability to regulation, though concrete changes are not yet fully promised for Xbox.

title: Microsoft announces plan to fully reopen corporate offices in Redmond, elsewhere
summary: Microsoft is planning to fully reopen its corporate campuses in Redmond and elsewhere by February 28, moving to the final stage of its hybrid work plan. This decision comes as COVID-19 cases from the omicron variant are waning and local vaccination rates are high, allowing for the return of employees, visitors, and guests. While facilities will fully open, the company will continue to allow some form of remote work and offer scheduling flexibility for many workers.

title: Microsoft tells workers to prepare to return to the office. (Published 2022)
summary: Microsoft has informed its employees that they will need to return to the office starting on February 28, transitioning back to a corporate campus environment for the first time since the Omicron variant. The company plans for a hybrid work model, allowing most employees to work from home up to 50 percent of the time. This decision is based on high vaccination rates and declining hospitalization and death rates in King County, where Microsoft's headquarters are located.

title: NERD ETF gains from strong demand for esports
summary: The Roundhill BITKRAFT Esports and Digital Entertainment ETF (NERD) has seen its share price rise due to sustained interest in esports and video games, as well as the excitement surrounding Microsoft's acquisition of Activision Blizzard. Despite a tough period over the last year, the ETF is benefiting from increased M&A activity in the gaming industry and strong demand figures for esports viewership and video game sales. The ETF's future growth is expected to be driven by continued demand, monetization model evolution including blockchain and NFTs, virtual reality, and cloud gaming.

title: Perion Network wins Microsoft Advertising award
summary: Perion Network has won a Microsoft Advertising award, gaining recognition for its work in the advertising technology sector. This achievement was highlighted in an article published in The Jerusalem Post. The company's success points to its advancements and contributions within the high-tech and business innovation landscape.

title: SPYG, VOOG, And IVW: It's Gut Check Time For Owners Of These S&P 500 Growth Funds
summary: This article examines three S&P 500 Growth Index ETFs: SPYG, VOOG, and IVW, highlighting their strong past performance and heavy concentration in mega-cap stocks. It suggests that while these funds are solid long-term choices, current market conditions, including a downward trend in earnings surprises, might present a better entry point in the future. The author also suggests considering the Invesco S&P 500 Pure Growth ETF for a different approach.

title: JPMorgan Chase, Toshiba and Ciena Build the First Quantum Key Distribution Network Used to Secure Mission-Critical Blockchain Application
summary: JPMorgan Chase, Toshiba, and Ciena have successfully built and demonstrated the first quantum key distribution (QKD) network for metropolitan areas, securing a mission-critical blockchain application. This groundbreaking research proves the viability of QKD to detect and defend against potential quantum computing attacks, supporting 800 Gbps data rates under real-world conditions. The network secured Liink by J.P. Morgan, the world's first bank-led, production-grade, peer-to-peer blockchain network, showcasing the technology's effectiveness against future quantum threats.

title: Insight Names Alexander L. Baum as Board Director
summary: Insight Enterprises has appointed Alexander L. Baum, a partner at ValueAct Capital and a significant investor in the company, as an independent director to its board. This addition aims to leverage Baum's extensive experience in IT industry strategy and investment expertise to further Insight's transformation into a leading solutions integrator. ValueAct Capital expresses excitement about deepening its relationship with Insight, believing its transformation in response to the changing IT landscape is underappreciated.

title: After delaying over crime concerns, Weyerhaeuser says workers will return to downtown Seattle office
summary: Weyerhaeuser is set to reopen its Pioneer Square headquarters in April 2022, after delaying reopening efforts last fall due to concerns about street crime in downtown Seattle. The timber company will implement a hybrid work schedule for employees. This move follows similar announcements from Microsoft and Expedia, signaling a broader return to office for Seattle-based companies.

title: What’s Changed: 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Enterprise Information Archiving
summary: The article analyzes the 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Enterprise Information Archiving, highlighting the evolving market driven by digital communication and application data. It discusses changes in vendor inclusion criteria, significant movements of key players like Global Relay and Veritas Technologies into the Leaders quadrant, and the strengths of various providers across the Leaders, Visionaries, and Niche Players categories, including Microsoft, Smarsh, Proofpoint, Mimecast, Micro Focus, ZL, Archive360, Solix Technologies, Barracuda, and Jatheon.

title: Accelerating Innovation Across the Portfolio: Blackstone Collaborates with Microsoft
summary: Blackstone's Portfolio Operations team is collaborating with Microsoft to accelerate digital transformation and improve operating performance across its portfolio companies. By leveraging Microsoft Cloud technologies, portfolio companies can standardize digital capabilities, integrate data for analytics, and accelerate innovation, as exemplified by Merlin Entertainments' rapid adoption of an Azure-based data lake. This strategic alliance aims to drive growth and create value through tailored industry solutions and enhanced digital infrastructure.

title: Mixed reality helps GE Healthcare train engineers to service complex equipment
summary: GE Healthcare, in collaboration with Microsoft MRPP partner Adjacentech Corporation, has developed a mixed-reality training system using HoloLens 2. This system aims to improve training efficiency and knowledge retention for engineers servicing complex medical equipment like CT and MRI scanners in China. By overlaying holographic 3D visualizations onto real-world objects, the solution provides accurate step-by-step guidance, reducing training time and the risk of equipment damage.

title: TikTok Star Corporate Natalie Wants You to Know a Few Things About Gen Z
summary: TikTok star Corporate Natalie provides business leaders with insights on how to support Gen Z in the workplace. She highlights the struggles of young workers adapting to hybrid work environments and offers advice on networking, empathy, leveraging side hustles for skill development, and fostering vulnerability. The article emphasizes the unique challenges faced by Gen Z in a post-pandemic work world and how leaders can address them.

title: Warner Music and BlackRock Invest $750 Million in Influence Media, Female-Led Music-Rights Firm
summary: Warner Music Group and BlackRock have jointly invested $750 million in Influence Media, a female-led music-rights firm. This partnership aims to acquire music-rights catalogs from female and diverse artists, focusing on newer, active catalogs rather than established older artists. Influence Media, founded by Lylette Pizarro and Lynn Hazan, plans to work with artists who will retain a stake in their work, and has already invested $300 million in 20 catalogs, including that of songwriter-producer Tainy and hitmaking team The Stereotypes.

title: How DBMS is Used by Hulu, JPMorgan Chase, and The Weather Company
summary: This article examines how Database Management Systems (DBMS) are crucial for organizations to efficiently store, retrieve, and manage data. It provides case studies of how major companies like Hulu, JPMorgan Chase, and The Weather Company leverage DBMS to address challenges, optimize operations, and maintain data integrity and security, highlighting the benefits over traditional file systems. The article demonstrates the real-world applications and positive outcomes of integrating DBMS in various industries.

title: CRM giant Salesforce acquiring B.C.’s Traction on Demand
summary: Salesforce.com Inc. is acquiring B.C.-based software firm Traction on Demand, which specializes in implementing marketing strategies using Salesforce's CRM services. The Burnaby-based company employs about 500 workers across British Columbia, and its founder had previously resisted selling the company. This acquisition follows Salesforce's recent spree of purchases, including Mobify and Slack Technologies Inc.

title: Electrolux
summary: Electrolux, a century-old innovator in home appliances, has implemented IBM's AI-driven operations (AIOps) solutions to automate its global IT infrastructure, significantly reducing IT issue resolution times and improving overall efficiency. This adoption of AIOps, particularly IBM Cloud Pak for Watson AIOps, allows Electrolux to streamline event correlation, enhance expertise within its IT teams, and contribute to its ambitious environmental sustainability goals, including achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050. The initiative has shown benefits ranging from faster problem-solving and cost savings to supporting remote work and integrating with manufacturing operations for improved efficiency and resilience.

title: KYNDRYL REPORTS FOURTH QUARTER AND FULL-YEAR 2021 RESULTS
summary: Kyndryl Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: KD) reported its fourth-quarter and full-year 2021 financial results, with full-year revenues totaling $18.7 billion and a net loss of $2.3 billion. The company is strategically positioning itself for growth through new partnerships with cloud hyperscalers and key initiatives focused on increasing signings, transforming service delivery, and addressing substandard margins. Kyndryl also announced significant strategic partnerships with major cloud providers and an expanded customer base following its spin-off from IBM.

title: Adobe named a Leader for fifth consecutive year in 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Digital Experience Platforms
summary: Adobe has been recognized as a Leader for the fifth consecutive year in the 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Digital Experience Platforms, positioned highest and furthest to the right for both Ability to Execute and Completeness of Vision. The company highlights its market-leading technology in integrated insights, AI/ML (Adobe Sensei), content management, scale and breadth (handling 21.5 trillion segment evaluations daily), real-time personalization, and the foundational Adobe Experience Platform. Adobe emphasizes its commitment to helping businesses deliver personalized customer experiences at scale, highlighting trust, data privacy, and efficient workflow management with Adobe Workfront as critical components for success.

title: EA, Oracle Among Companies Heeding Ukraine Plea to Stop Business in Russia
summary: Ukraine has requested that approximately 50 tech companies, including Oracle and EA, cease operations in Russia to isolate the country and pressure its government following military action. In response, Oracle announced the suspension of all operations in the Russian Federation, and EA Sports committed to removing Russian national and club teams from its FIFA games. Other major companies like Spotify, Twitter, Meta, Microsoft, and Google have also taken steps to restrict Russian state media or suspend services in Russia.

title: Wide Moat Stock Outlook Remains Compelling
summary: The article discusses the compelling outlook for wide moat stocks, highlighting their historical outperformance, especially in rising interest rate and high inflation environments. It notes that while the VanEck Vectors Morningstar Wide Moat ETF (MOAT) is outperforming the S&P 500 year-to-date, its performance is impacted by highly valued mega-cap growth stocks, which now present opportunities to buy quality at a discount. The analysis emphasizes that wide economic moats protect companies for extended periods, contributing to long-term outperformance with less volatility.

title: After clearing all regulatory hurdles, Microsoft closes $20B Nuance deal
summary: Microsoft has finalized its $20 billion acquisition of Nuance Communications after successfully navigating all regulatory approvals, including those from the U.S. Justice Department, the EU, and the British Competition and Markets Authority (CMA). This move signifies Microsoft's deeper entry into the healthcare sector, with CEO Satya Nadella indicating plans to expand Nuance's AI technology beyond healthcare into other verticals like financial services and telecommunications. The CMA concluded that the acquisition would not substantially lessen competition in the healthcare transcription market.

title: Microsoft closes on $16 billion acquisition of Nuance
summary: Microsoft has completed its $16 billion acquisition of speech recognition company Nuance Communications. This deal, Microsoft's second-largest, aims to expand its presence in the healthcare industry through Nuance's medical dictation and transcription tools. The acquisition received clearance from British and European Union antitrust regulators after initial scrutiny.

title: Our Ultimate Stock-Pickers' Top 10 Buys and Sells
summary: This article identifies the top 10 high-conviction buys and sells among Morningstar's Ultimate Stock-Pickers for the fourth quarter of 2021, based on an aggregate analysis of their holdings. It highlights key companies like Microsoft and 3M as top buys and Marsh & McLennan as a prominent sell, detailing the Morningstar analysts' fair value estimates, economic moats, and investment theses for these firms. The report assists investors by providing insights into attractive investment ideas and valuation considerations.

title: Adaptive Biotechnologies lays off 12% of workforce to narrow immunosequencing tech
summary: Adaptive Biotechnologies announced a layoff of 12% of its workforce (about 100 employees) as part of a restructuring to focus on two core areas: minimal residual disease and immune medicine. The company also appointed Tycho Peterson as the new CFO, a move analysts believe will positively impact its stock. These changes aim to streamline operations and clarify the company's mission for investors.

title: Billion-dollar Seattle company Adaptive Biotechnologies lays off 100
summary: Seattle-based Adaptive Biotechnologies, valued at $1.6 billion, announced a layoff of 100 employees from its 850-worker staff as part of a restructuring effort. The company is streamlining its workforce and appointing a new chief financial officer while focusing on its cancer diagnostic test, clonoSEQ, and infectious disease-specific cell mapping research. Despite a pandemic-driven stock price surge, shares have significantly declined from their January 2021 high.

title: Biden must safeguard Russian internet access, civil society warns
summary: Civil society groups are urging the Biden administration to protect internet providers in Russia from sanctions, arguing that cutting off web access would isolate dissidents and strengthen the Kremlin's control. They recommend that the Office of Foreign Asset Controls formally authorize U.S. internet services, software, and hardware to preserve web access, citing precedents from past sanctions campaigns. The groups warn that without clear guidance, individuals in Russia could be cut off from vital internet services.

title: IonQ to Present Research at American Physical Society (APS) Annual Meeting 2022
summary: IonQ announced its participation in the American Physical Society (APS) March Meeting 2022, where co-founder and CTO Jungsang Kim will be honored for his pioneering contributions to quantum computing. IonQ researchers will present new advances in quantum chemistry simulations, risk aggregation using quantum generative modeling, and general quantum learning of joint probability distribution functions. The company will also discuss application-oriented performance benchmarks for quantum computing, including its new #AQ single-number benchmark.

title: Metaverse Technology Redefining Digital Experience
summary: The metaverse is emerging as a significant technological advancement, moving beyond gaming to redefine digital experiences across various industries. Companies like Facebook (Meta), Nike, and Microsoft are investing heavily, with projections indicating global metaverse revenue could approach $800 billion by 2024. While offering potential for retail, enterprise solutions, and new markets like virtual real estate and entertainment, the metaverse also faces challenges related to data security, legal frameworks, skilled resources, VR device limitations, and potential negative societal impacts.

title: Coca-Cola FEMSA se transforma digitalmente para mantener siempre conectados a sus colaboradores
summary: Coca-Cola FEMSA has partnered with Microsoft to implement digital transformation initiatives, particularly focusing on Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Teams, to enhance communication and collaboration among its employees across 10 countries. This strategic alliance has allowed Coca-Cola FEMSA to optimize operational processes, maintain business continuity, and facilitate remote work, as evidenced by over 200,000 interactions among 19,200 employees and the successful virtual "Semana de Desarrollo" event. The company emphasizes the importance of flexible technological allies to adapt to changing operational needs and ensure continuity in a new normal.

title: Webroot sues CrowdStrike, Sophos, others over alleged patent infringement
summary: Webroot and its parent company OpenText are suing Trend Micro, Sophos, Kaspersky, and CrowdStrike for alleged infringement of several malware detection patents, some dating back to 2005. The lawsuits, filed in the Western District of Texas, claim these defendants infringe upon Webroot's intellectual property related to endpoint security products and platforms. Competitors and observers criticized the move, with CrowdStrike calling it typical of a "patent troll" and others viewing it as "patent bullying."

title: Corporate tax departments face intertwined challenges: A talent shortage, regulatory uncertainty, and difficulty leveraging data
summary: Corporate tax departments are grappling with a talent shortage, an uncertain regulatory landscape, and difficulties in leveraging data effectively. A KPMG survey highlighted talent as the biggest risk, exacerbated by the ongoing "Great Resignation" and fewer individuals entering the accounting profession. Additionally, evolving business and regulatory environments require tax professionals to develop broader skill sets and utilize technology for strategic guidance, but many departments lack the necessary tools and expertise.

title: Rogers and Microsoft announce strategic alliance to revolutionize hybrid workplace communications and power 5G innovation across Canada with Azure
summary: Rogers and Microsoft have announced a five-year strategic alliance to accelerate digitization for businesses in Canada, focusing on hybrid work and 5G-enabled solutions. Rogers will leverage Microsoft Azure for its cloud infrastructure and will be the first in Canada to offer Operator Connect Mobile, a comprehensive communication and collaboration solution built on Microsoft Teams. This partnership aims to enhance customer digital experiences, drive 5G innovation through Azure, and provide secure, reliable communication services, enabling businesses to reduce costs and improve agility.

title: Great Expectations: Making Hybrid Work Work
summary: This article discusses the evolving landscape of hybrid work, highlighting how employee expectations have changed significantly since the pandemic, prioritizing health, well-being, and flexibility. Based on a Microsoft Work Trend Index study of 31,000 people, it outlines five key trends for leaders, emphasizing the need to empower managers, rethink the office's role, rebuild social capital in a digital-first world, and establish sustainable flexible work practices to avoid digital exhaustion. The study reveals that employees are actively reshaping their work lives, making flexibility and wellbeing non-negotiable for future success.

title: The Impact of Design on the Employee Experience
summary: Workday's Chief Design Officer, Jeff Gelfuso, emphasizes the importance of delivering seamless and engaging end-to-end experiences for employees within enterprise software, mirroring consumer software expectations. He discusses how Workday is achieving this through simplification, personalization, connectedness, and data-driven insights. The article highlights key design principles and Workday's initiatives like Engage, Everywhere, and Empower to improve the employee experience.

title: What is Okta and how its hack could affect Cloudflare, Coinbase and others
summary: Identity management company Okta Inc. is investigating a digital breach, the scope of which is currently unknown. This hack could have significant implications for thousands of companies like Cloudflare and Coinbase that rely on Okta for access management. Okta, which serves over 15,000 customers and has more than 100 million registered users, is known for its Single Sign-On and Multi-factor Authentication services.

title: Tackling Global Supply Chain Disruption
summary: This article discusses how Microsoft has addressed global supply chain disruptions caused by the pandemic, focusing on leveraging technology for agility and resilience. It highlights digitizing factories, using AI/machine learning for data and logistics, and integrating sustainability. The article also introduces Microsoft's Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Insights as a solution for organizations seeking to build resilient supply chains.

title: How To Multiply The QQQ’s Dividend Yield By 15
summary: This article criticizes the low dividend yield of Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) and suggests an alternative, Nuveen Nasdaq 100 Dynamic Overwrite Fund (QQQX), for significantly higher dividend income. The author explains how QQQX uses covered call options to generate a 7.3% dividend, contrasting it with QQQ's 0.5% yield and the less effective Global X Nasdaq 100 Covered Call ETF (QYLD). It highlights QQQX's strategy of cherry-picking profitable tech stocks and its advantage as a closed-end fund often trading at a discount.

title: 16-year-old living with his mom is Lapsus$ mastermind behind Microsoft hack, cyber detectives say
summary: Cybersecurity researchers have traced a string of hacks against major technology companies like Microsoft, Nvidia, and Okta to a 16-year-old living with his mother near Oxford, England. This teenager, known online as "White" and "breachbase," is believed to be the mastermind behind the Lapsus$ hacking group, which has engaged in social engineering and extortion campaigns, often taunting victims and recruiting insiders. The group, which Microsoft tracks as "DEV-0537," is known for its poor operational security, allowing researchers to gain insights into its members who also include a suspected teenager in Brazil.

title: Nouveau Monde Graphite Provides a Quarterly Update and Releases its Annual Report – Disciplined Execution of the Company’s Business Plan
summary: Nouveau Monde Graphite (NMG) has released its year-end financial results for 2021, showcasing significant progress towards completing its Phase-1 facilities and advancing its Phase-2 commercial scale-up. The company is nearing completion of its 2,000-tonnes-per-annum integrated graphite production line for anode material and is actively defining the economic model for its Phase 2 while engaging with potential customers and financial partners. NMG also highlights its commitment to ESG principles, carbon-neutral operations, and sustainability in its production of advanced graphite materials for the electric vehicle and renewable energy sectors.

title: What’s Changed: 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Analytics and Business Intelligence Platforms
summary: This article analyzes changes in Gartner's 2022 Magic Quadrant for Analytics and Business Intelligence Platforms, highlighting new market trends and vendor shifts. It details the leaders, challengers, visionaries, and niche players, noting additions and removals from the previous year's report. The report emphasizes visual self-service, augmented AI, and the divergence of traditional BI from data science and machine learning.

title: Pwning Microsoft Azure Defender for IoT | Multiple Flaws Allow Remote Code Execution for All
summary: SentinelLabs uncovered critical vulnerabilities in Microsoft Azure Defender for IoT, including flaws in the password recovery mechanism and several SQL injection vulnerabilities, allowing unauthenticated remote code execution. These vulnerabilities, tracked with CVEs, impact both cloud and on-premise customers, leading to potential full network compromise if unpatched. Microsoft has released security updates to address these issues, urging users to update immediately.

title: Keurig brews a more perfect cup of coffee with Azure IoT Central
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper is leveraging Azure IoT Central to revolutionize the coffee experience with connected brewers featuring BrewID™ technology. This solution enables personalized brewing, simplifies fleet management for commercial partners, and provides valuable consumer insights. The use of Azure IoT Central significantly reduced development time and accelerated time to market for Keurig’s smart brewers.

title: Synopsys Launches Industry's First Broad-Scale Cloud SaaS Solution to Transform Chip Development Landscape
summary: Synopsys has launched Synopsys Cloud, the industry's first broad-scale cloud Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution for chip development. This new model, optimized for electronic design automation (EDA) and deployed on Microsoft Azure, offers a pay-per-use approach to provide unparalleled flexibility and efficiency for complex chip designs. The collaboration with Microsoft aims to streamline access to compute and EDA resources, addressing the escalating demands of chip design and verification.

title: Outbrain expands strategic partnership with Microsoft, leveraging Microsoft Azure to improve business outcomes for media owners and advertisers – Middle East & Africa News Center
summary: Outbrain Inc. and Microsoft have expanded their strategic partnership, with Outbrain leveraging Microsoft Azure for its media platform. This multi-year engagement aims to accelerate innovation, global expansion, and improve connectivity for advertisers and publishers on Outbrain's platform. The partnership reinforces both companies' commitment to supporting independent journalism and enhancing business outcomes through advanced technology.

title: Microsoft's cloud business targeted by EU antitrust regulators
summary: EU antitrust regulators are questioning Microsoft's rivals and customers regarding its cloud business and licensing deals, potentially leading to a formal investigation. European antitrust enforcers are scrutinizing whether Microsoft is leveraging its dominant position in some software markets to unfairly compete in cloud computing services, following complaints from several European tech companies. The inquiry focuses on licensing deal terms, technical limitations, and the differences in license fees between various programs.

title: Business On Air – MTR
summary: This article features an interview with Ted Suen, CIO of MTR Corporation, discussing their digital transformation strategy and its impact on their 40,000 global staff. MTR, as Hong Kong's key railway operator, has a long history of technological innovation, and its current focus is on empowering employees and improving customer experience through its Digital Workplace Initiative. Suen emphasizes that executive support and an engaging change program, including gamification and design thinking, were crucial for overcoming challenges and seizing opportunities during the implementation, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Internet of Things Market Size [2022-2029] Worth USD 2465.26 Billion | Exhibiting a CAGR of 26.4%
summary: The global Internet of Things (IoT) market is projected to reach USD 2,465.26 billion by 2029, growing at a CAGR of 26.4% from USD 384.70 billion in 2021. This growth is driven by the increasing penetration of smart cities, deployment of vehicle solutions, and strong demand from the healthcare sector. Key players like Amazon Web Services, Intel, and Microsoft are focusing on product rollouts and technological advancements.

title: Clean Harbors’ CIO: Hybrid approach to the cloud is a win-win
summary: Clean Harbors, a hazardous waste cleanup giant, has adopted a hybrid cloud strategy, leveraging Microsoft Azure for advanced AI and RPA capabilities while retaining its core Waste Information Network (WIN) on-premises. This approach allows them to innovate with cloud services for customer-facing applications and data analytics, while ensuring the high availability and security of critical legacy systems and data, a model increasingly favored by enterprises. The company's CIO, Sharon Gabriel, highlights their cautious, methodical approach to cloud adoption, informed by past experiences and a need to manage 42 years of sensitive data.

title: Putnam’s Collins Draws On Nature For ESG Investing Inspiration
summary: Katherine Collins, head of sustainable investing at Putnam Investments, integrates biomimicry and insights from nature, specifically honeybees, into her ESG investment strategies. After a career in traditional finance and a master's degree from Harvard Divinity School, Collins applies a unique lens to identify companies demonstrating leadership in sustainability. Her approach focuses on balancing risk and opportunity, evidenced in her co-management of Putnam Sustainable Leaders (PNOYX) and Putnam Sustainable Future (PMVYX) funds.

title: Ball Aerospace Collaborates with Microsoft Azure on On-orbit Computing
summary: Ball Aerospace is partnering with Microsoft Azure to enhance on-orbit satellite data processing, combining Ball's space-based hardware expertise with Microsoft's cloud capabilities. This collaboration aims to create "smart" satellites that extend cloud data processing power to space, enabling faster, more flexible, and dynamic data handling for complex missions. Future demonstrations will test this software on-orbit, leveraging Microsoft Azure's integrated cloud services for advanced analytics and mission-critical government workloads.

title: Take-Two Interactive Software Inc. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
summary: Take-Two Interactive Software Inc. stock fell 3.09% on Wednesday amidst a broader market decline, closing at $147.20. Despite the loss, the stock demonstrated mixed performance compared to competitors like Microsoft, Sony, and Activision Blizzard, which also experienced declines. The trading volume for Take-Two exceeded its 50-day average.

title: Leveraging Intel Technology as a Force for Good
summary: Intel's RISE Technology Initiative supported 63 projects in the past year, investing $9.5 million to leverage Intel technology, employee talent, and partnerships for global good. These projects address accessibility, economic recovery, education, health and life sciences, social equity and human rights, and sustainability and climate. The initiative demonstrates how technology can be a force for positive change across diverse communities worldwide.

title: What’s Changed: 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Transportation Management Systems
summary: This article highlights the changes in the 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Transportation Management Systems (TMS), outlining the core and expanded capabilities of TMS software. It details the leaders, challengers, and niche players identified by Gartner, providing insights into their strengths, weaknesses, and target markets. Key updates include the addition of 3Gtms and the absence of BluJay Solutions due to its acquisition by E2open.

title: DeFiChain Adds New dTokens Corresponding to Disney, Intel, MicroStrategy, and iShares MSCI China ETF
summary: DeFiChain has announced the addition of four new decentralized tokens, or dTokens, following a community vote. These new dTokens correspond to Walt Disney Co ($dDIS), iShares MSCI China ETF ($dMCHI), MicroStrategy Incorporated ($dMSTR), and Intel Corporation ($dINTC), allowing users to gain price exposure to these traditional assets without ownership. DeFiChain, a blockchain built on the Bitcoin network, aims to provide decentralized financial applications and services, expanding its dToken universe to offer an alternative to traditional financial brokers.

title: ServiceNow CEO Bill McDermott: ‘We’re In A Market Of One’
summary: ServiceNow CEO Bill McDermott asserts his company is the workflow automation market leader, aiming to become a $15 billion SaaS powerhouse by building a "platform of platforms." He contends ServiceNow operates in a "market of one" due to its unique ability to integrate and automate disparate enterprise workflows onto a single, cloud-native platform, addressing what he calls "islands of automation" that hinder business flexibility and security. McDermott also emphasizes the critical role of channel partners and talent development in ServiceNow's vision for growth and innovation, including significant R&D investment and a focus on AI and low-code platforms.

title: Vnet receives acquisition offer from Chinese investment firms
summary: Vnet, formerly 21Vianet, has received an unsolicited preliminary non-binding acquisition offer from Chinese investment firms Hina Group and Industrial Bank Co., Ltd. The proposal is to acquire all outstanding ordinary shares for US$8 in cash per American depositary share. Following the announcement, Vnet's shares jumped over 20 percent, despite having fallen significantly earlier in the year.

title: Sungard Availability Services Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy
summary: Sungard Availability Services has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in the U.S. and for protection under the CCAA in Canada, seeking to complete the process within four to six months. This follows a previous Chapter 11 filing in 2019 and insolvency proceedings for its UK subsidiary, highlighting ongoing financial distress due to declining revenue, fixed costs, and competition from cloud providers. The company's restructuring support agreement contemplates either a sale of assets or equitization of its prepetition funded debt.

title: BPCL collaborates with Microsoft to leverage cloud and AI to redefine customer experience
summary: Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd. (BPCL) and Microsoft have announced a seven-year strategic cloud partnership to accelerate BPCL's digital transformation and enhance customer experience in the oil and gas industry. This collaboration, part of BPCL's 'Project Anubhav', will leverage Microsoft's cloud and AI capabilities, including Azure, for initiatives like UFill for an innovative fueling solution, IoT-powered supply chains, and a conversational AI chatbot named Urja for customer support. The partnership aims to build a resilient, cloud-led business operation, redefine customer experience through trust, personalization, and convenience, and strengthen BPCL's business operations with security at its core.

title: IBM Revenue Up 8% on Continued Momentum in Hybrid Cloud Business
summary: International Business Machines Corp. reported an 8% revenue increase in the first quarter, surpassing analysts' expectations, driven primarily by strong performance in its hybrid cloud platform. Revenue rose to $14.2 billion from $13.19 billion a year earlier, beating the anticipated $13.78 billion. This growth reflects the continued momentum in IBM's hybrid cloud business, which saw a 14% revenue increase, highlighting its importance in the company's transformation strategy.

title: Netflix Loses $54 Billion in Market Cap After Biggest One-Day Stock Drop Ever
summary: Netflix experienced its biggest one-day stock drop ever, losing $54 billion in market capitalization after announcing its first subscriber loss in over a decade and projecting further losses. Analysts downgraded the stock, citing market saturation, increased competition, and the impact of account sharing, leading to a significant reassessment of the company's growth prospects.

title: JPMorgan Chase, Microsoft among growing number of companies turning to neurodiverse workers to help meet need for talent
summary: A growing number of companies, including JPMorgan Chase and Microsoft, are actively recruiting neurodiverse individuals to fill talent needs and leverage their unique skills. This trend is driven by an increasing recognition of the neurodiverse population, their problem-solving abilities, and the ongoing demand for talent, with companies implementing structured programs for interviewing, hiring, and onboarding. These initiatives not only provide career opportunities for neurodiverse workers but also positively impact company culture and team dynamics.

title: Kraft Heinz and Microsoft join forces to accelerate supply chain transformation
summary: Kraft Heinz is partnering with Microsoft to digitally transform its supply chain using Microsoft Azure, marking its largest technology investment to date. This collaboration aims to create a more resilient supply chain by establishing a "supply chain control tower" and "digital twins" of manufacturing facilities, leveraging AI, IoT, and data analytics. The initiative seeks to enhance operational efficiency, anticipate consumer demand, and optimize product delivery for Kraft Heinz's extensive portfolio.

title: Tim Aimone – Hewlett Packard Enterprise
summary: Tim Aimone, Director of Workplace Design and Project Management at Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), led the design of the company's new Houston headquarters. Opened in February 2022, the innovative office space is a "workplace of the future" designed for a hybrid work model, emphasizing collaboration, comfort, and integration of technology. The design prioritizes flexibility and employee well-being, reflecting lessons learned from the pandemic and HPE's existing "work from the edge" philosophy.

title: Low Volatility Stocks Usually Do Well—But There Are Traps
summary: A Northern Trust Asset Management paper warns that while low-volatility stocks generally outperform over time, they can present traps, particularly in real estate, utilities, and consumer staples sectors. Rising interest rates and economic vulnerability can negatively impact these types of low-volatility holdings. NTAM advises focusing on companies with strong cash flows, profitability, and solid balance sheets to mitigate these risks.

title: Kraft Heinz taps Microsoft to build up supply chain visibility
summary: Kraft Heinz is partnering with Microsoft to enhance its supply chain visibility and resilience. The collaboration involves creating a "Supply Chain Control Tower" and "digital twins" of 34 manufacturing facilities using Microsoft's Azure, machine learning, and analytics to improve efficiency and address disruptions. This move is part of Kraft Heinz's broader digital transformation strategy.

title: Slack is definitely part of Salesforce now, and here’s proof
summary: Salesforce and Slack are launching "Salesforce Platform for Slack," allowing developers to build functionality that integrates Salesforce data into Slack. This move solidifies Slack's integration with its parent company, offering enhanced collaboration and automation capabilities while still maintaining compatibility with third-party business tools. Slack cofounder Cal Henderson provides a nuanced perspective on the acquisition, highlighting the benefits of working with Salesforce's thriving ecosystem.

title: Why AWS, Microsoft, Google, Visa Are Setting Base In Kenya
summary: Major tech companies like Amazon Web Services, Microsoft, Google, and Visa are establishing operations in Kenya due to its growing economy and increasing client demand for cloud computing services. Kenya's strategic location as East Africa's largest economy and a hub for Fortune 500 companies makes it an attractive market for expansion. This move is driven by the need to meet local data residency requirements and capitalize on the burgeoning African cloud computing industry.

title: Advisors Are Powering Portfolios With Thematic ETFs
summary: Thematic ETFs, which invest in companies poised to benefit from long-term transformative changes, are increasingly being adopted by financial advisors as a replacement for traditional sector funds. These ETFs offer more precise exposure to growth trends like blockchain, emergent food, robotics, and electric vehicles. Asset managers are expanding their thematic ETF offerings, with BlackRock (iShares) recently launching two new products in this space, highlighting a growing conviction in the long-term benefits of thematic investing despite some recent market volatility.

title: The Cybersecurity Threats Self-Storage Operators Face Today and How to Defend Against Attacks
summary: This article discusses the increasing cybersecurity threats faced by self-storage operators, who are often targeted due to fewer resources compared to larger companies. It outlines common attack types such as ransomware, spearfishing, cryptomining malware, cloud vulnerabilities, and endpoint attacks. The piece also provides actionable defense strategies including staff training, two-factor authentication, secure wireless networks, fortified endpoints, data backups, and selecting reputable service providers.

title: Nasdaq 100 Index: Tech Stocks Lose $1.8 Trillion in a Month Thanks to Fed
summary: Tech investors have experienced the worst start to the year in two decades, with the Nasdaq 100 Index losing over $1.8 trillion in value in April alone. This decline is attributed to a tumultuous earnings season, fears of an economic slowdown, and aggressive expectations regarding the Federal Reserve's rate-hike trajectory, with another hike anticipated next week. Investors are bracing for continued volatility in the market.

title: Top 10 Growth Stocks by Market Capitalization
summary: This article defines growth stocks and explains how they differ from other investment types, highlighting their potential for capital appreciation and typical reinvestment strategies. It then presents a list of the top 10 large-cap growth stocks as of April 2022, detailing their market capitalization, forward P/E ratio, dividend status, and specific growth drivers for each company. The article also touches on general market performance of growth stocks and factors influencing their volatility.

title: Microsoft deepens investment in Canada with the opening of new headquarters and expansion of operations to empower economic growth – Microsoft News Center Canada
summary: Microsoft has opened its new Canadian headquarters in Toronto, marking a significant investment in the country's innovation economy. A new EY report indicates Microsoft's ecosystem supports nearly 300,000 jobs and contributes $37 billion to Canada's GDP. The company is also expanding its regional presence, supporting innovation projects, and a skills initiative that has trained over one million Canadians.

title: Web3: It’s time to level up
summary: HSBC's Rajeev Tummala discusses Web3, defined as the read-write-own era of the internet, where users control their data and interact in virtual worlds like the metaverse. He highlights its potential applications beyond gaming in financial services, education, and entertainment, while also acknowledging challenges such as intellectual property, regulation, and data privacy. The article concludes that Web3 will likely combine both centralized and decentralized systems and that financial institutions have a crucial role to play in its evolution.

title: Microsoft signs 110MW PPA with AES to power California data centers
summary: Microsoft has signed a 20-year Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) with AES to provide 110MWAC solar and 55MW, 4-hour storage renewable energy for its data centers in California. This agreement builds on previous collaborations between Microsoft and AES in Virginia and Chile, helping Microsoft achieve its goal of 100 percent renewable energy by 2025. The energy will partially match Microsoft's load at its California-based data centers, sourced from projects within the CAISO region.

title: Kraft Heinz wants to solve its supply chain problems — in the metaverse
summary: Kraft Heinz is leveraging the metaverse and a partnership with Microsoft to enhance its supply chain efficiency. By creating "digital twins" of its facilities, the company aims to resolve logistical issues virtually, speed up operations, and ensure products like Lunchables and Velveeta reach shelves faster. This technological investment seeks to improve dependability and responsiveness to shifting consumer demands.

title: Holy-Moly Mortgage Rates Hit 5.64%, 10-Year Treasury Yield 3.12%, Long-Term Treasury Bond Fund Gets Massacred
summary: Mortgage rates have surged to 5.64%, the highest since 2009, as the 10-year Treasury yield rose to 3.12%. This has led to a significant increase in monthly mortgage payments, impacting housing demand. A long-term Treasury bond ETF has plunged, indicating a "bond massacre" for investors who previously viewed bonds as a conservative investment.

title: Intel Expands Atlanta Presence Across Software Development Team
summary: Intel is significantly expanding its software development team in Atlanta, planning to add over 100 new local jobs with six-figure salaries as part of a larger goal to create 500 jobs by 2024. This move reinforces Atlanta's growing reputation as a tech hub, alongside other major companies like Cash App, Nike, and Microsoft also establishing or expanding their presence in the city. The new roles will focus on areas like AI, cloud, and security, utilizing Atlanta's diverse technology community and talent base.

title: When Momentum Fails
summary: The article discusses how momentum, a historically strong investment factor, has shown signs of faltering in recent months despite its long-term outperformance. It highlights that while momentum stocks have often delivered strong returns, periods of market decline and shifts in investor sentiment can lead to sharp drawdowns, emphasizing that nothing lasts forever in investing.

title: Salesforce To Take Over Troops.ai For Microsoft Teams, Slack Integration Power
summary: Salesforce plans to acquire Troops.ai, a company that provides integration tools for Slack and Microsoft Teams, to enhance its Slack offerings. Troops.ai specializes in delivering real-time insights and revenue signals from CRM systems like Salesforce to communication platforms, aiming to improve sales velocity and collaboration. The acquisition, expected to close before July 31, will integrate Troops.ai's technology into Slack, bolstering its capabilities for customer-facing teams.

title: Intel Introduces Project Amber for Cloud-to-Edge and On-Premises Trust Assurance
summary: Intel announced Project Amber, a new service designed to provide remote verification of trustworthiness in cloud, edge, and on-premises environments, addressing the growing need for enhanced security and confidential computing. The company also detailed its efforts in securing AI deployments through partnerships and outlined a strategy for quantum-resistant cryptography by 2030, beginning with its 3rd Generation Intel Xeon Scalable platform. These initiatives aim to build trust and security for current and future technology landscapes.

title: KKR to buy SK’s gas production facility for more than $785 mn
summary: KKR & Co. is set to acquire SK Materials Airplus Inc.'s industrial gas production facility from SK Inc. for over $785 million, outbidding competitors like Macquarie and Brookfield. The acquisition will secure a steady cash flow for KKR due to SK Materials Airplus's long-term supply contract with SK Hynix. This aligns with KKR's recent active investment strategy in South Korea, particularly in the energy and environmental sectors.

title: 3 Reasons Advisors Are Adding BLKC & SATO to Portfolios
summary: Advisors are incorporating BLKC and SATO ETFs into portfolios for three main reasons: portfolio diversification, capitalizing on the transformative growth of digital assets, and using them as a potential hedge against inflation. These ETFs offer exposure to the cryptocurrency industry, with BLKC focusing on blockchain developments and SATO on the broader crypto economy. The article highlights the increasing institutional investor interest and the finite supply of some cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin as key attractions.

title: Bill Gates Sells $940 Million of CN Rail Stock
summary: Bill Gates' investment firm, Cascade Investment, sold approximately $940 million worth of Canadian National Railway Co. shares between April 27 and May 12, reducing its stake in the company to about 9%. This sale is part of an ongoing reduction in ownership since May 2021. Gates' former wife, Melinda French Gates, and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation also sold significant portions of their Canadian National shares.

title: Starbucks to add abortion travel coverage to U.S. health benefits
summary: Starbucks Corp announced it will reimburse U.S. employees for travel expenses if they need to go more than 100 miles from home to obtain an abortion. This decision follows a leaked Supreme Court draft opinion that suggests Roe v. Wade could be overturned, leading to tighter abortion restrictions in some states. Starbucks joins other major companies like Amazon and Microsoft in offering similar benefits.

title: Starbucks to cover employees’ travel expenses for abortions; gender surgeries
summary: Starbucks announced an expansion of its health care benefits to cover travel expenses for employees seeking abortions or gender-affirming procedures if these services are not available within 100 miles of their homes. This decision comes in the wake of a leaked draft U.S. Supreme Court opinion potentially overturning Roe v. Wade, with the company affirming its commitment to ensuring employee access to quality healthcare. Starbucks joins other major companies in offering this benefit, consistent with its history of advocating for liberal causes.

title: Microsoft TechSpark announces expansion to Jackson, Mississippi
summary: Microsoft's TechSpark initiative is expanding to Jackson, Mississippi, to address the digital divide and foster inclusive economic opportunities. The expansion will focus on digital skills training, computer science education, broadband connectivity, and digital transformation for nonprofits and startups, spearheaded by Jackson resident JJ Townsend. Key initial collaborations include supporting Jackson State University's Cybersecurity Readiness program, gener8tor Skills Accelerator, Innovate Mississippi’s CoBuilders Accelerator, and the Jackson Tech District Makerspace.

title: Amazon replaces Microsoft as Seattle area's top corporate giver
summary: Amazon has surpassed Microsoft as the leading corporate philanthropist in the Seattle area, according to a recent report. Amazon significantly increased its charitable giving, particularly in areas like housing, contributing millions more than Microsoft. This shift marks a notable change in the philanthropic landscape of Washington.

title: Clorox Announces Appointment of Julia Denman and Stephanie Plaines to its Board of Directors
summary: The Clorox Company announced the appointment of Julia Denman and Stephanie Plaines to its board of directors, expanding the board to 13 members. Both Denman and Plaines bring extensive financial expertise and leadership experience from various sectors, enriching the board's diversity and qualifications. They are expected to serve on the audit committee, contributing to Clorox's strategic goals and stakeholder value.

title: Microsoft moves forward with massive corporate campus project in Atlanta
summary: Microsoft is proceeding with ambitious plans to develop a massive 90-acre corporate campus in Atlanta, Georgia, over the next decade, expecting to create thousands of jobs. The project, located at Quarry Yards, will dedicate 25% of the property to community projects like affordable housing and grocery stores, and Microsoft is actively seeking community feedback for the site's design with a strong focus on sustainability. Local politicians and community leaders have expressed enthusiasm for the economic and social benefits the campus will bring to Atlanta.

title: Kitchen Brains Accelerates Growth with Investment from Source Capital
summary: Kitchen Brains, a designer and manufacturer of smart cooking computers and software solutions for commercial foodservice, has been acquired by Source Capital, LLC. The investment aims to accelerate Kitchen Brains' product pipeline, bolster scalability, and provide greater access to financial and human capital resources. Kitchen Brains plans to deepen existing customer relationships and expand its hardware and software offerings globally.

title: Nevada regulators grant investor Barry Diller limited license as MGM board member
summary: The Nevada Gaming Commission granted media mogul Barry Diller a two-year limited gaming license to serve on the MGM Resorts International board due to an ongoing federal investigation into his stock purchases. Regulators cited Diller's cooperation with the SEC regarding Activision Blizzard Inc. stock acquired before Microsoft's announced acquisition, which resulted in a $60 million profit for him and associates. Despite MGM's legal team arguing for a full license, and Diller denying any wrongdoing, commissioners opted for a limited license to allow time for the federal inquiry to conclude.

title: International Business Machines Corp. stock underperforms Friday when compared to competitors
summary: International Business Machines Corp. (IBM) stock fell 0.91% to $128.48 on Friday, May 20, 2022, underperforming the broader stock market, which saw the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average rise slightly. This marked the third consecutive day of losses for IBM, leaving its stock $17.51 below its 52-week high. While IBM declined, some competitors showed mixed performance, with Apple Inc. (AAPL) rising and Microsoft Corp. (MSFT) and Alphabet Inc. Cl A (GOOGL) falling.

title: WacoWatch
summary: Judge Albright granted Microsoft Corporation's motion to transfer a patent litigation case to the Western District of Washington, finding it to be a more convenient venue. The decision was based on an analysis of private and public interest factors, including the location of evidence and witnesses, and despite the plaintiff's argument about Microsoft's past venue practices. Three factors favored transfer, one disfavored it, and four were neutral.

title: Take-Two completes $12.7B acquisition of mobile games giant Zynga
summary: Take-Two has completed its $12.7 billion acquisition of mobile games giant Zynga, bringing popular titles like Farmville and Words With Friends under its ownership. This strategic move aims to significantly increase Take-Two's net bookings from the fast-growing mobile gaming segment and enable substantial cost synergies and revenue opportunities. The acquisition merges two gaming powerhouses, expanding Take-Two's mobile presence and providing Zynga access to a vast library of franchises for new gaming experiences.

title: Microsoft Technology Center in Zurich officially opened
summary: Microsoft Switzerland has officially opened its Microsoft Technology Center (MTC) at its new headquarters in The Circle at the Zurich Airport. This 1,000 square meter space is designed to be an innovation hub where customers can envision and test new technology and industry-specific scenarios. The MTC represents a significant investment by Microsoft to drive innovation and co-innovation in Switzerland, built on over 30 years of local presence and partnerships.

title: Exclusive: Oracle to win unconditional EU nod for $28.3 billion Cerner deal
summary: Oracle is expected to receive unconditional EU antitrust clearance for its $28.3 billion acquisition of U.S. healthcare IT company Cerner Corp. This deal, Oracle's largest ever, aims to boost its cloud platform by leveraging Cerner's data for AI-based cloud services and attracting more healthcare clients. The European Commission is scheduled to decide on the deal by June 1.

title: Qualcomm CEO sees growth in high-end phones even if economy slows
summary: Qualcomm CEO Cristiano Amon believes the company will continue to see growth in the high-end smartphone market, despite concerns about an economic slowdown. He noted that consumers are increasingly seeking "better phones" with more capabilities, and Qualcomm is gaining market share in premium devices. Amon also highlighted the potential for augmented reality to become as significant as smartphones, expanding Qualcomm's partnerships in the AR/VR space.

title: Cisco Takes Top Spot In Gartner Supply Chain Top 25 Despite Record Backlog
summary: Cisco maintained its leading position in Gartner's Global Supply Chain Top 25 report for the third consecutive year, despite facing record-breaking customer order backlogs due to ongoing supply chain challenges. The tech giant's proactive strategies, including investing $10 billion to secure chip supplies, adapting its operations, and focusing on ESG and circular economy concepts, contributed to its continued success. Cisco is also mitigating disruptions by working closely with suppliers, optimizing logistics, and promoting refurbished equipment through its Cisco Refresh program.

title: Johnson Controls Appoints Rodney Clark as Vice President and Chief Commercial Officer
summary: Johnson Controls (NYSE: JCI) has appointed Rodney Clark as vice president and chief commercial officer, effective June 1, 2022. Clark will be responsible for leading the company's global sales excellence and growth strategy, particularly focusing on decarbonization in smart, healthy buildings. He joins Johnson Controls from Microsoft, where he previously held significant roles in global partner sales and Internet of Things (IoT) sales.

title: The Hanover Insurance Group’s automation CoE ensures successful solutions can scale
summary: The Hanover Insurance Group established an automation Center of Excellence (CoE) to drive digital transformation and improve productivity. By leveraging Microsoft Power Platform, particularly Microsoft Power Automate, the company has successfully scaled solutions across various departments, enhancing business decision-making, stakeholder relationships, and employee efficiency. The CoE aims to integrate automation into daily operations, demonstrating its success through use cases like the FastTrack renewal prep solution and a Surety Commission automation that prevented significant business disruption.

title: Global Data Annotation Tools Market Size, Share Forecast to 2033
summary: The global data annotation tools market was valued at USD 2.87 billion in 2024 and is projected to reach USD 23.82 billion by 2033, growing at a CAGR of 26.50%. Key growth drivers include the rapid penetration of AI in healthcare and massive data generation via advanced technologies, while the inaccuracy of some tools remains a restraint. Asia Pacific is expected to dominate the market, with North America also showing significant growth.

title: Michal Braverman-Blumenstyk appointed as CTO for Microsoft’s new Security, Compliance
summary: Microsoft has appointed Michal Braverman-Blumenstyk as Chief Technology Officer for its new Security, Compliance, Identity, and Management Division. She will continue to serve as General Manager of Microsoft Israel R&D Center and her appointment is part of a comprehensive company-wide reorganization merging all security products into a single division. Braverman-Blumenstyk has a strong background in cybersecurity and artificial intelligence, having founded the Microsoft Cyber Security Center in Israel and significantly grown the Israel R&D Center's workforce.

title: Short-term profits and long-term consequences — did Jack Welch break capitalism?
summary: This article examines the legacy of Jack Welch, former CEO of General Electric, through an interview with New York Times correspondent David Gelles. Gelles argues in his book "The Man Who Broke Capitalism" that Welch's ruthless cost-cutting, focus on short-term profits, and practices like "stack ranking" ultimately harmed GE, American workers, and capitalism itself. The interview discusses GE's historical significance, Welch's management style, the impact of his policies on employees, and the eventual dismantling of GE into three separate companies.

title: MyDIGITAL and Microsoft commit to innovation, digital skills, and building economic resilience for Malaysia
summary: MyDIGITAL and Microsoft announced the MyDIGITAL GovTech Innovation partnership in Malaysia, focusing on enhancing digital skills for civil servants and strengthening the nation's economic resilience. This initiative builds on existing collaborations, aiming for widespread cloud adoption and digital literacy within the government by 2025. Microsoft reaffirms its commitment to Malaysia's digital transformation, celebrating 30 years in the country with goals to skill 300,000 people by 2024 and an additional 1 million Malaysians by the end of 2023.

title: Accenture, Microsoft and Avanade expand partnership to help organizations tackle their greatest sustainability challenges
