The article highlights how SMBC's approach to digital transformation also involves a cultural shift, emphasizing talent empowerment and a customer-first mindset, positioning them for "digital perseverance" in a changing industry.

title: Microsoft named a Leader in 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Cloud Infrastructure and Platform Services
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in the 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Cloud Infrastructure and Platform Services for the ninth consecutive year, also placing furthest on the Completeness of Vision axis for the first time. The article highlights Microsoft's commitment to hybrid and multicloud solutions, continuous innovation in Azure services like Azure Arc and Microsoft Dev Box, and investments in mission-critical workloads and global datacenter expansion. It emphasizes Microsoft's dedication to helping customers optimize cloud investments and achieve their business goals amidst economic uncertainties.

title: Johnson Controls Honors Intaleq with OpenBlue Pioneers Award for First of Its Kind Stadium Technology at World Cup Qatar 2022
summary: Johnson Controls has awarded Intaleq with the OpenBlue Pioneers Award for creating a revolutionary connected digital command center for the World Cup Qatar 2022. This solution, powered by Johnson Controls OpenBlue and Microsoft Azure, transforms eight World Cup stadiums into one connected digital space, enabling real-time situational awareness and incident management. The technology utilizes "3D digital twins" for each stadium, providing live data on safety, comfort, and sustainability to significantly enhance security and operational efficiency during the event.

title: Inside Kforce’s new innovative hybrid HQ hub
summary: Kforce Inc. has unveiled its new 22,232-square-foot hybrid headquarters in Midtown Tampa, designed for an "office occasional" workforce model where employees are not required to work physically in the office. This innovative space, a fifth the size of their previous Ybor City office, emphasizes collaboration and offers various zones and advanced technology to support remote and in-office work. The company's decision was reinforced by a survey showing 93% of jobseekers prefer a hybrid remote setting, aligning with the evolving post-pandemic work landscape and addressing the soft office market.

title: The anti-ESG funds exploiting the US political divide
summary: The article discusses the rise of anti-ESG funds in the US, which are exploiting the political divide by offering investments that prioritize shareholder value over socially responsible agendas. These funds, such as Strive Asset Management and ACVF, cater to investors who believe ESG investing is politically motivated and detrimental to financial returns. Despite their growing media attention, experts question their overall impact on corporate behavior and capital movement compared to traditional large asset managers.

title: State of NJ Department of Community Affairs
summary: The State of New Jersey Department of Community Affairs (DCA) partnered with IBM Consulting to streamline aid distribution, particularly for utility debt relief, following the American Rescue Plan Act of 2021. IBM's solution, including portals and virtual agents, enabled the DCA to disperse over $127 million in aid and manage hundreds of thousands of calls, significantly improving efficiency and citizen access to critical assistance. This partnership allowed the DCA to quickly adapt to increased demand while maintaining service quality.

title: Raytheon Technologies collaborates with Microsoft to accelerate key business priorities through cloud adoption
summary: Raytheon Technologies is deepening its collaboration with Microsoft Corp. (Nasdaq: MSFT) to equip its employees with cloud-based tools, technologies, and platforms to enhance collaboration, optimize operations, and unlock intelligent insights. This partnership leverages Microsoft 365 and Azure to reduce data center footprint, accelerate speed-to-market for products, and drive data-driven insights through predictive analytics. The initiative aims to support business growth and operational excellence within the aerospace and defense company.

title: Regeneron turns to IT to accelerate drug discovery
summary: Regeneron Pharmaceuticals is leveraging IT, particularly cloud computing and advanced data platforms, to significantly accelerate its drug discovery process. CIO Bob McCowan has spearheaded a major digital transformation, migrating the company's data to a multicloud environment (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and developing a MetaBio Data Discovery Platform, empowering scientists with tools to experiment and test hypotheses more efficiently. This strategic IT investment aims to reduce the drug development timeline from ten years to as few as four or five.

title: Unified Communication as a Service (UcaaS) Market | Industry Trends and Forecast 2022-2030
summary: Acumen Research and Consulting has published a report on the Unified Communication as a Service (UCaaS) Market, providing an in-depth study of current industry trends, recent developments, and the competitive landscape. The report covers market segmentation by deployment and industry vertical, as well as a geographic analysis across major regions. It includes competitive analysis of leading players and identifies opportunity areas for investors in the UCaaS market up to 2030.

title: Insight sows seed of cloud analytics for GrainCorp
summary: Insight Enterprises has developed a new cloud infrastructure for GrainCorp, leveraging Microsoft Azure services to enhance its analytics capabilities. This infrastructure addresses previous ad-hoc data processes, improving efficiency and enabling more robust decision-making for GrainCorp, particularly in areas like freight optimization and supply-demand matching. The project has already demonstrated significant improvements in data consistency and the speed of critical operations.

title: Catawba County News
summary: Microsoft Corp. plans to invest a minimum of $1 billion in the phased development of four datacenters in Catawba County over the next 10 years. These datacenters, located in Conover, Hickory, and Maiden, are expected to create at least 50 new jobs. The announcement was made by leaders from Catawba County, the Cities of Conover and Hickory, the Town of Maiden, and the Catawba County Economic Development Corporation.

title: Eli Lilly Clarifies It’s Not Offering Free Insulin After Tweet From Fake Verified Account—As Chaos Unfolds On Twitter
summary: Eli Lilly issued a clarification that it is not offering free insulin after a fake, verified Twitter account impersonating the company tweeted that it was, highlighting confusion and misinformation spreading on the platform due to Twitter Blue's new subscription verification service. This incident is one of several similar occurrences since Twitter Blue launched, with other fake verified accounts impersonating public figures and spreading false information. The chaos unfolds amidst drastic changes at Twitter, including mass layoffs and concerns about potential major incidents.

title: Reza Partners with Perfect Corp. to Enable Virtual Try On of Jewelry
summary: French jewelry brand Reza has collaborated with Perfect Corp. to integrate AI and AR virtual try-on technology into its new eCommerce website. This technology, featuring Perfect Corp.'s AgileHand, allows customers to virtually try on rings, earrings, and bracelets in real-time digital renderings. The partnership aims to enhance the luxury accessories shopping experience by providing an immersive and impactful virtual try-on solution.

title: Dow pops 1,200 points, S&P 500 jumps 5% in biggest rally in two years after light inflation report
summary: Stocks experienced their largest rally since 2020 following an October consumer price index report that suggested inflation might have peaked. The Dow Jones Industrial Average surged 1,201.43 points (3.7%), the S&P 500 rose 5.54%, and the Nasdaq Composite jumped 7.35%. This market reaction was driven by a lower-than-expected CPI reading, leading traders to anticipate a less aggressive stance from the Federal Reserve regarding interest rate hikes.

title: Microsoft unveils ‘Supply Chain Center’ with Kraft Heinz, Daimler among customers
summary: Microsoft has launched a new "Supply Chain Center" and "Supply Chain Platform" to integrate various supply chain systems and offer a unified solution. Major customers like Kraft Heinz North America and Daimler Truck North America are already utilizing the technology to enhance agility and optimize costs. The new offerings aim to connect data across different ERPs and third-party solutions, including SAP and Oracle, providing a comprehensive view of the supply chain.

title: Top 10 Oracle Competitors & Alternatives
summary: This article identifies and describes the top 10 competitors and alternatives to Oracle, a leading US-based multinational technology company providing database solutions, cloud engineering, and enterprise software products. It details each competitor's launch year, founders, headquarters, and key products/services, offering insights into the competitive landscape of the tech industry.

title: Kraft Heinz Bets (Even) Bigger On Supply Chain Visibility
summary: Kraft Heinz is deepening its partnership with Microsoft, adopting the new Supply Chain Center to enhance supply chain visibility through AI-backed capabilities. This initiative is part of a larger transformation to integrate and centralize data, allowing for more agile risk assessment and improved product delivery across North America. The platform leverages AI models for demand and supply insights, order management automation, and Teams integration to streamline operations and decision-making.

title: AI-powered video and audio editing app Descript raises $50M
summary: Descript Inc., an AI-powered video and audio editing platform, has raised a $50 million Series C funding round led by the OpenAI Startup Fund, bringing its total raised to over $100 million. Founded by former Groupon CEO Andrew Mason, the app simplifies editing for podcasters and videographers using AI and has launched new features, including background removal and scene creation, to make video editing as intuitive as using a Word document. OpenAI's COO Brad Lightcap expressed excitement for tools like Descript that empower creators.

title: Nvidia says it is working with Microsoft to build 'massive' cloud AI computer
summary: Nvidia Corp is partnering with Microsoft Corp to build a "massive" cloud AI computer on Microsoft's Azure cloud, utilizing thousands of Nvidia's powerful H100 and A100 GPUs. This collaboration aims to handle intense artificial intelligence computing work, driven by the increasing demand for faster processing from AI models. Nvidia will also be a customer of Microsoft's AI cloud computer, developing AI applications for its own services.

title: Microsoft Shareholders | Who Owns The Most Shares of Microsoft?
summary: This article identifies the major shareholders of Microsoft (MSFT) amidst a 27% year-to-date loss in its stock value. It details the top institutional holders like The Vanguard Group and Capital Group, as well as significant individual insiders including founder Bill Gates and CEO Satya Nadella, while also providing an overview of Microsoft's business segments.

title: Microsoft named a Leader in 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Full Life Cycle API Management
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader for the third consecutive year in the 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Full Life Cycle API Management. This recognition highlights Microsoft's understanding of customer needs, strong adoption, and continuous investment in its Azure API Management platform. The article details new capabilities, including support for WebSocket and GraphQL APIs, enhanced hybrid and multicloud management, security improvements, and geographic expansion, empowering customers like Wegmans and Vipps in their digital transformation journeys.

title: 20 Instagram Reel ideas for all types of brands
summary: This article provides 20 diverse Instagram Reel ideas tailored for various types of brands, including fashion and retail, higher education, B2B companies, government agencies, nonprofits, travel/tourism, and healthcare. It emphasizes the importance of short-form video content for engagement on Instagram and offers specific examples and strategies for each industry to create effective Reels. The suggestions range from showcasing products and brand values to engaging students, promoting events, and using trending sounds or ASMR.

title: Is DigitalOcean Stock a Buy Now?
summary: DigitalOcean is presented as a cloud infrastructure company targeting small businesses, developers, and startups, distinguishing itself from giants like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud with competitive pricing. The article highlights DigitalOcean's strong financial performance in Q3, including significant revenue growth and ambitious targets for 2024, despite considerations about stock-based compensation affecting free cash flow. The author concludes that DigitalOcean is a strong buy due to its rapid growth, reasonable stock valuation, and focused niche market.

title: Maria Alvarez Joins Alkami Board of Directors
summary: Maria Alvarez, VP, AI Platform, Cloud and AI Division at Microsoft Corporation, will join Alkami Technology, Inc.'s Board of Directors effective January 1, 2023. She brings extensive experience in product strategy, operational and technical excellence, and digital transformation. This appointment follows the departure of Merline Saintil and Mike Hansen from the board.

title: Ciena Deepens Foray Into Access with Two Acquisitions
summary: Ciena Corp. is expanding its broadband access portfolio with two key acquisitions: Tibit Communications and Benu Networks. Tibit, acquired for approximately $210 million, specializes in pluggable optical line terminals for PONs, while Benu Networks, purchased for an undisclosed sum, offers a cloud-native platform for edge functions including virtual Broadband Network Gateways. These acquisitions aim to strengthen Ciena's presence in the lucrative broadband access market, which is a growing segment of its overall sales.

title: Why Nokia’s 6G Wireless Technology Ambitions Could Make It a Top Cloud Enabler
summary: Nokia is positioning itself as a key cloud enabler by leading Europe's 6G rollout through the Hexa-X-II initiative, a consortium of 44 organizations. The article highlights how 6G's advancements in capacity, lower latency, reliability, and security are crucial for developing and adopting cloud technologies. Despite the slow 5G rollout, Nokia's focus on 6G aims to meet the accelerated demand for telecommunications infrastructure driven by cloud, automation, and immersive platforms.

title: NASDAQ Trading - How to invest in NASDAQ (US100) index?
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide on investing in the NASDAQ (US100) index, detailing its structure, how it works, and reasons for its high volatility. It explains different trading positions (long and short) and identifies opportune times for trading, such as during periods of market panic or significant company announcements. The article also touches upon the use of CFDs and ETFs for investing in NASDAQ.

title: Ibens cuts Review Turnaround Times by 75% and Fuels Highest Quality Outcomes
summary: Belgian construction company Ibens has significantly reduced review turnaround times by 75% and improved project outcomes by implementing Autodesk Construction Cloud’s BIM 360 solution. This platform enabled them to deliver their first school construction project three months ahead of schedule by streamlining collaboration, improving data accessibility, and enhancing communication with clients and partners. Ibens aims to further innovate by developing an intelligent self-learning system from their accumulated project data.

title: Amazon Launches Supply-Chain Software Service
summary: Amazon Web Services has launched a new supply-chain software service, entering the burgeoning tech sector that aims to bring more efficiency and visibility to goods management. This move positions Amazon alongside established players like Blue Yonder and SAP, as well as other big operators such as Microsoft, in helping businesses navigate supply chain disruptions. The service is expected to find a ready audience among the thousands of small- and medium-sized businesses on Amazon's third-party marketplace.

title: Salesforce shares tumble after surprise exit of co-CEO Taylor
summary: Salesforce Inc (CRM.N) shares fell by about 10% after co-CEO Bret Taylor's unexpected departure, raising concerns about the company's co-CEO leadership model and slowing revenue growth. This exit prompted at least 17 brokerages to cut their price targets on the stock, with analysts noting it as a significant blow given Taylor's leadership role in product development. Taylor's departure comes after just one year in the co-CEO role, leaving co-founder Marc Benioff as the sole top boss.

title: BJ’s connects advertisers with customers across channels
summary: BJ's Wholesale Club is launching its own retail media network called BJ’s Media Edge, in collaboration with Microsoft PromoteIQ. This platform aims to connect advertisers with its 6.5 million members across various channels, providing real-time analytics and data. This move follows a similar trend in retail, with Sam's Club also expanding its advertising solutions.

title: Microsoft advances plan for new $400M Loudoun data center
summary: Microsoft is nearing final permit approval for a new $400 million data center project in Loudoun County, Virginia. The site plan for this fast-track development has already received approval. This initiative is part of a larger trend of data center development in the region.

title: How suite of dividend growth ETFs brings quality to the fore
summary: In an environment of market volatility and economic uncertainty, CI WisdomTree ETFs offer a quality-focused core portfolio solution that has outperformed benchmarks. These dividend growth ETFs, managed by CI Global Asset Management, employ a unique methodology to identify companies with strong fundamentals, sustainable earnings, and resilient business models, screening for quality and growth metrics. This strategy aims to provide diversified large-cap exposure and long-term stability by avoiding overvalued companies and focusing on profitable dividend payers, proving particularly effective during periods of economic contraction.

title: Microsoft Is Raising Price of New Xbox Games to $70 Starting Next Year
summary: Microsoft (MSFT) announced it will increase the price of its new Xbox games to $70 starting in 2023, following similar moves by other major gaming companies. This $10 price hike will apply to next-generation titles like Starfield, Redfall, and Forza Motorsport, with the company stating it reflects the content's scale and technical complexity. These games will also be accessible through Microsoft’s Game Pass subscription service.

title: Rackspace Hosted Exchange failure due to 'ransomware incident'; company faces class-action lawsuit
summary: Rackspace Technology Inc. announced that the major failure of its Hosted Exchange service was due to a "ransomware incident," affecting thousands of customers for five days. Following this, a class-action lawsuit was filed against the company for negligence and breach of confidence, among other claims. Rackspace stated it's investigating with a cyber defense firm and migrating affected customers to Microsoft 365, while its stock price has dropped significantly.

title: Pentagon Divides Big Cloud-Computing Deal Among 4 Firms (Published 2022)
summary: The Pentagon awarded lucrative cloud-computing contracts, potentially valued at up to $9 billion, to Amazon, Google, Microsoft, and Oracle. This decision marks a significant shift from an earlier attempt to award a sole contract to Microsoft, which was later scrapped after legal challenges and a recognition that the department's needs had evolved. The new Joint Warfighting Cloud Capability project aims to provide comprehensive cloud services across all security domains and classification levels for the Defense Department.

title: Google, Oracle, Amazon, Microsoft to share $9 billion ‘return of JEDI’ defense contract
summary: Google, Oracle, Amazon, and Microsoft will jointly share a $9 billion hybrid contract from the Pentagon to provide secure cloud services globally. The contract, known as Joint Warfighting Cloud Capability, is scheduled for completion by June 8, 2028, with work to be performed in Reston, Va. This agreement follows previous discussions and changes regarding the Department of Defense's cloud computing needs.

title: Pentagon splits $9 billion cloud contract among Google, Amazon, Oracle and Microsoft
summary: The Pentagon awarded $9 billion worth of cloud computing contracts to Google, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft, and Oracle. These Joint Warfighting Cloud Capability (JWCC) contracts will provide enterprise-wide cloud services across all security domains and classification levels until 2028. This move signifies the military's shift towards utilizing multiple vendors for its cloud computing needs, learning from past litigation that halted a single-vendor IT modernization project.

title: Microsoft’s law firm diversity program: celebrating top performers in 2022
summary: Microsoft's Chief Legal Officer, Hossein Nowbar, discusses the company's 2022 Law Firm Diversity Program (LFDP) results. The program, now in its 14th year, incentivizes law firms to achieve diversity representation goals, focusing on increasing diversity in leadership roles. While overall progress in diverse partnership ranks saw modest increases, Microsoft celebrates firms that have significantly advanced diversity within their organizations.

title: Coca-Cola United automates over 50,000 orders in complex SAP invoicing process with Microsoft Power Platform
summary: Coca-Cola United has significantly improved its operational efficiency by using Microsoft Power Platform to automate two key processes: on-demand shipment requests and a complex SAP invoicing process. The automation reduced order validation time from half a day to seconds and enabled the processing of over 50,000 orders, freeing up valuable employee time and supporting strategic growth. The company plans to continue automating more business processes using Microsoft Power Automate RPA capabilities, further reducing labor costs and improving accuracy.

title: Microsoft acquires Lumenisity®, an innovator in hollow core fiber (HCF) cable
summary: Microsoft has acquired Lumenisity® Limited, a leader in hollow core fiber (HCF) solutions, to enhance its global cloud infrastructure and address the strict latency and security requirements of its Cloud Platform and Services customers. Lumenisity's HCF technology offers increased speed, lower latency, enhanced security, and lower costs compared to traditional fiber, benefiting sectors like healthcare, financial services, manufacturing, retail, and government. This acquisition will enable Microsoft to accelerate innovations in networking and infrastructure by integrating Lumenisity’s technology and expert team.

title: SPDR Gender Diversity ETF Officially Changes Index, Name
summary: The SPDR MSCI USA Gender Diversity ETF (SHE) has officially changed its underlying index and name to the MSCI USA Gender Diversity Select Index. This ETF, a pioneer in gender-focused funds with $208.65 million in assets, now holds 281 stocks and seeks to identify companies committed to gender diversity across all organizational levels. The index is sector-agnostic, with holdings weighted by market capitalization and gender diversity scores.

title: Annual Shareholders Meeting 2022
summary: Microsoft's Annual Shareholders Meeting for 2022 covered financial performance, strategic priorities, and shareholder proposals. Key topics included record financial results in FY22, investments in AI and cloud computing, and responses to shareholder concerns regarding diversity, fair chance employment, climate change, government contracts, and tax transparency. The leadership team also discussed balancing strategic growth with cost management and the ongoing FTC lawsuit regarding the Activision Blizzard acquisition.

title: 5 Charts on Big Tech Stocks’ Collapse
summary: In 2022, Big Tech stocks collectively lost nearly $4 trillion in market value, with the Morningstar US Technology Index down 28.7%. This collapse significantly impacted overall market returns, contributing 7 percentage points to the U.S. market index's 18.7% loss. Factors like recession fears, advertising slowdowns, and changes in consumer spending led to substantial declines for companies such as Meta Platforms, Amazon, Alphabet, Microsoft, and Nvidia.

title: Microsoft and Viasat Partner to Provide Satellite Internet Services to Underrepresented Communities in Africa
summary: Microsoft and Viasat have partnered to provide satellite internet services to 10 million people globally, including 5 million across Africa by 2025, through Microsoft's Airband initiative. The project, which begins in Angola, Egypt, and Senegal, aims to bridge the digital divide by offering telehealth, distance learning, and other services. This collaboration also leverages the existing relationship between Viasat and Microsoft Azure Space to enhance satellite connectivity and address the lack of internet access in Africa, where simplified licensing procedures are facilitating global companies' efforts.

title: Four Retention Strategies to Avoid Tech Talent Turnover
summary: This article outlines four key strategies for retaining tech talent amidst the current competitive landscape. It emphasizes valuing technologists' time, fostering innovation through appropriate tools, ensuring employees feel heard, and building a team-centric culture. The strategies aim to create an environment where tech professionals want to join and stay, thereby reducing turnover and its associated costs and impacts on organizational goals.

title: Microsoft names new Chief Sustainability Officer
summary: Microsoft has appointed Melanie Nakagawa as its new Chief Sustainability Officer, reporting directly to President & Vice Chair Brad Smith. Nakagawa, with nearly two decades of experience in environmental sustainability, will lead Microsoft's company-wide environmental initiatives, focusing on achieving carbon negative, water positive, and zero waste goals by 2030, accelerating innovation for customers, and partnering with external organizations for global sustainability progress. Her appointment comes as Microsoft accelerates its sustainability efforts amid increasing global climate challenges discussed at COP27.

title: MSCI ONE Aims to Help Investors Turn Data Into Insights
summary: MSCI Inc. has launched MSCI ONE, an open architecture technology platform built on Microsoft Azure, designed to help investors convert vast amounts of data into actionable insights for investment decisions. The platform provides next-generation quantitative investment analytics through a modern web-based experience, combining flexible distribution, cloud delivery, dashboards, and visualizations. MSCI ONE offers single-point access to various services like MSCI Risk Insights, Climate Solutions, and its Developer Community, emphasizing improved client experience through transformational technology.

title: Microsoft named a Leader in the 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Global Industrial IoT Platforms
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in the 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Global Industrial IoT Platforms for the third consecutive year. The article highlights Microsoft's continued innovation and investment in industrial IoT, emphasizing key areas such as IT/OT convergence, cloud and on-site innovations, digital twins and the metaverse, security advancements, and collaborations with partners. Microsoft's Azure IoT platform aims to help industries improve operations to become more efficient, agile, and sustainable.

title: NetApp Develops Software to Unify Hybrid Multicloud Management
summary: NetApp has released BlueXP software, a unified control plane designed to simplify hybrid multicloud management for companies by automating operations across on-premises and public cloud environments. This new offering aims to address the complexity of modern diverse IT landscapes, providing a single point of visibility and management for various storage assets. BlueXP integrates an AIOps engine, AI-enabled health monitoring, advanced security features including a ransomware dashboard, and a pay-per-play model with NetApp Keystone services.

title: Gaming peripheral market size to increase by USD 5,610.35 million: APAC will account for 35% of the market's growth during the forecast period - Technavio
summary: The global gaming peripheral market is projected to grow by USD 5,610.35 million at a CAGR of 9.41% during the forecast period. The Asia-Pacific (APAC) region is expected to contribute 35% of this growth, driven by an increase in gamers adopting gaming as a career. Key market drivers include the rising popularity of e-sports and advanced gaming consoles, while challenges include counterfeit products and high peripheral costs.

title: Microsoft, Cisco Shareholder Votes Demonstrate Increasing Investor Demand for Tax and Offshore Transparency
summary: Shareholders of Microsoft and Cisco, representing hundreds of billions in investments, voted in favor of proposals calling for public country-by-country reporting on offshore operations and tax practices. This trend indicates growing investor demand for transparency regarding potential risks associated with opaque offshore activities. The FACT Coalition highlights that public country-by-country reporting is becoming inevitable due to global momentum and regulatory considerations in jurisdictions like the EU, Australia, and the U.S.

title: Infographic: Log4Shell Vulnerability Impact by the Numbers
summary: This article presents an infographic detailing the impact of the Log4Shell vulnerability based on a Qualys Research Team study. It highlights the widespread exposure across industries and the challenges in remediation, revealing enterprise IT's exposure and response across various criteria. The infographic covers threat landscape, vulnerability trends, remediation trends, and attack patterns, emphasizing the unprecedented nature of the Log4Shell risk.

title: 'WHAT… HAPPENED'? A look back on crypto's 'biggest year yet' (for fraud, hacks, implosions…)
summary: This article provides a comprehensive look back at the tumultuous year 2022 for the cryptocurrency market, detailing significant events such as major frauds, hacks, and implosions of key platforms and stablecoins. It covers a month-by-month breakdown of happenings, including initial high hopes for adoption, the Terra/LUNA collapse, the "Great Crypto Contagion" of June, the Ethereum Merge, and the eventual downfall of FTX and Sam Bankman-Fried. The author questions the common prediction of a "builders" year ahead, suggesting a contrarian outcome may still be possible.

title: iShares MSCI ACWI Index Fund (ACWI) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the iShares MSCI ACWI Index Fund (ACWI), including its stock price, key statistics, top holdings, and dividend information. It details the fund's portfolio as of July 31, 2025, highlighting major tech companies like NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple among its top constituents. The report also includes performance metrics and historical data for ACWI.

title: iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV), including its current stock price, key statistics, asset holdings, and dividend information. It highlights IGV's top holdings as of September 30, 2025, which include Palantir Technologies Inc, Microsoft Corp, Oracle Corp, Salesforce Inc, and ServiceNow Inc, and details the ETF's latest trades and historical performance data.

title: Stock Market Outlook 2023 for the Worst Performing S&P 500 Sectors
summary: This article provides an outlook for the worst-performing S&P 500 sectors in 2022, including Technology, Real Estate, Consumer Discretionary, and Communication Services. It analyzes the performance of key holdings within each sector, their outlook for 2023, and analyst sentiment with options market probabilities for recovery. The forecast indicates that a full recovery to previous highs for these sectors and their major constituents is unlikely in the short term.

title: Should John Hancock Multifactor Large Cap ETF (JHML) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The John Hancock Multifactor Large Cap ETF (JHML) offers broad exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market, launched in 2015 with over $722 million in assets. It has an expense ratio of 0.29% and a 1.46% dividend yield. The ETF's portfolio is heavily allocated to Information Technology, with top holdings including Microsoft, Apple, and Amazon.

title: Top 14 project management software and tools to level-up collaboration
summary: This article identifies 14 top project management software and tools to enhance team collaboration and efficiency. It explores the benefits of using such software, key features to look for, and provides a breakdown of tools suitable for cross-functional collaboration, agencies, and enterprise companies. The article aims to help teams choose the right solution to streamline project planning, coordination, and execution.

title: Does This Acquisition Make Microsoft a Bear Market Buy?
summary: Microsoft's recent acquisition of a 4% stake in the London Stock Exchange Group and a 10-year strategic partnership to create a centralized financial data platform could make it an attractive investment. This move aims to strengthen Microsoft's competitive position in the cloud and financial data markets, projecting $5 billion in revenue from the partnership. The acquisition could broaden and diversify Microsoft's income streams amidst a rapidly growing global finance cloud market, helping it maintain its lead against competitors like Amazon and Google Cloud.

title: WisdomTree U.S. Dividend Growth Fund (DGRW) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the WisdomTree U.S. Dividend Growth Fund (DGRW), including its stock price, holdings, and dividend yield. As of the latest N-PORT filing on September 30, 2025, the fund holds 301 stocks with a total value of $16.30 billion, with top holdings being Microsoft, Apple, NVIDIA, Exxon Mobil, and Chevron. The article also presents key statistics, performance data, and historical breakdowns of the fund's portfolio.

title: DXC Technology Identifies Five Cybersecurity Trends that will Impact Life and Business in 2023 and Beyond
summary: DXC Technology has identified five key cybersecurity trends for 2023 and beyond, including an acceleration of the cybersecurity arms race with AI, increased risks in the metaverse, and a rise in geopolitical cyberattacks. The company also predicts that critical national infrastructure will be a growing target for cyber adversaries and highlights the increasing career opportunities within the cybersecurity sector due to a significant global talent shortfall.

title: TD SYNNEX Unveils New Fraud Defense Solution to Combat Widespread Security Risks
summary: TD SYNNEX has launched a new fraud defense solution, the SMB Fraud Defense Click-to-Run™ solution, which integrates Microsoft Azure services to combat increasing cloud-based security threats for small and medium businesses. This solution aims to elevate security postures through phishing prevention, proactive alerts, and warning signals, leveraging Microsoft Azure Active Directory and cost management features. The company emphasizes the growing cyber and security threats, highlighting the need for advanced solutions to protect businesses from significant financial losses due to cybercrime.

title: Getty Images suing the makers of popular AI art tool for allegedly stealing photos
summary: Getty Images has filed a lawsuit against Stability AI, the creator of the AI art tool Stable Diffusion, alleging copyright infringement. The stock image company claims Stability AI copied and processed millions of its images without obtaining proper licenses. This action highlights the growing tension between traditional media suppliers and AI art generators, as artists become concerned about their work being used for AI training without credit.

title: Sobre a J.B. Hunt Transport, Inc.
summary: J.B. Hunt Transport, Inc., uma líder em transporte da Fortune 500, migrou suas cargas de trabalho de nuvem para otimizar o desempenho e a eficiência. A empresa utilizou o IBM Turbonomic para gerenciar recursos, resultando em 2.000 ações de redimensionamento e uma economia de 650 horas anuais, além de uma migração bem-sucedida do Azure para o Google Cloud com tempo de inatividade zero. A solução também auxilia na otimização contínua e na colaboração para reduzir o desperdício em ambientes de contêineres e na automação de ações não disruptivas.

title: AI Time: 10 Ways Artificial Intelligence is Getting Real
summary: A new report from Citi Global Insights highlights 10 areas of innovation in Artificial Intelligence, a market that has grown significantly at a 35% CAGR since 2015. The article discusses key AI technologies such as Large Language Models, AI Art, Quantum for AI, Edge AI, and Explainable AI, detailing their market potential and impact. It also features insights from leading AI experts on the future trajectory of AI development.

title: Microsoft and OpenAI extend partnership
summary: Microsoft and OpenAI are extending their partnership with a multiyear, multibillion-dollar investment to accelerate AI breakthroughs. This agreement will expand their collaboration in AI supercomputing and research, allowing both companies to independently commercialize advanced AI technologies. Microsoft will integrate OpenAI's models into its products and Azure will remain OpenAI's exclusive cloud provider, powering all its workloads.

title: ServiceNow CEO: Our Ambition Is to Be the Defining Enterprise Software Company of the 21st Century
summary: ServiceNow's CEO, Bill McDermott, articulated the company's ambition to become "the defining enterprise software company of the 21st century" during its Q4 2022 earnings call. The company reported strong financial results with total revenue of $1,940 million and subscription revenue growth of 20% and 22% year-over-year respectively. ServiceNow also emphasized its transition towards becoming a platform company, aiming to capitalize on a $500 billion market opportunity with its Now Platform.

title: Dow Chemical to cut 2,000 jobs
summary: Dow Chemical announced Thursday it will cut approximately 2,000 jobs from its workforce as part of a plan to achieve $1 billion in cost savings in 2023. The company has been battling soaring energy costs following the Russian invasion of Ukraine and reported a 17% drop in net sales during the fourth quarter of 2022. This move aligns with a trend of major corporations, particularly in the tech industry, implementing mass layoffs recently.

title: Procter & Gamble CIO: ‘Everybody Must Own the Digital Story’
summary: Procter & Gamble CIO Vittorio Cretella emphasizes the importance of digital transformation across the entire CPG ecosystem to improve customer experiences, build loyalty, and drive growth. He details how P&G leverages technologies like AI, IoT, and cloud computing for everything from product formulation and manufacturing efficiency to consumer engagement and privacy. Cretella also addresses challenges in scaling AI, highlighting the need for integrating data, developing talent, and fostering a culture that embraces automation while prioritizing consumer trust and data privacy.

title: Dole plc offloads US fresh veg division to unit of Chiquita Brands International
summary: Dole plc has sold its fresh vegetables division in the US to Fresh Express, a subsidiary of Chiquita Holdings, for US$293 million. This sale aims to strengthen Dole's financial position and increase its focus on core activities. The transaction, which includes agricultural operations and four processing plants, is subject to US regulatory approval.

title: HubSpot, Pinterest Add to Tech Layoff Chaos
summary: HubSpot and Pinterest have joined other major tech companies in announcing layoffs, with Pinterest cutting 150 employees (less than 5% of its workforce) and HubSpot letting go of around 500 staff (7% of its total workforce). These cuts reflect a continuing trend of mass layoffs in the tech sector due to a tumultuous 2022 and an uncertain economic climate, with over 82,000 tech workers laid off since the beginning of the year. Companies are implementing various cost-cutting measures, but the stream of layoffs is expected to continue for some time.

title: New DDoS-as-a-Service Platform Attacking Medical Institutions
summary: Passion Group, an affiliate of Killnet and Anonymous Russia, has launched a DDoS-as-a-Service platform. This platform, identified by Radware, was used to target medical institutions in multiple countries as retaliation for supporting Ukraine. The service offers various attack vectors and pricing models, accepting payments in Tether, QIWI, and Bitcoin, and is used by pro-Russian hackers.

title: Calamos Investments Launches New Sustainable Equities ETF SROI
summary: Calamos Investments has launched the Calamos Antetokounmpo Global Sustainable Equities ETF (SROI) on NYSE ARCA, in collaboration with NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo. This actively managed ETF aims for long-term capital appreciation by investing in quality growth companies that integrate ESG principles, utilizing both traditional financial and nonfinancial indicators. The fund will also donate a portion of its profits to charity, reflecting a commitment to community impact.

title: Software company Autodesk lays off 250 employees
summary: Autodesk, a software company, has laid off 250 employees, which is less than 2% of its global workforce. This decision is part of its fiscal year 2024 plans to align resources with key priorities and comes amidst a global economic downturn affecting many tech companies. The affected roles include digital marketing, technical marketing, and web optimization, though the company continues to hire for other key positions.

title: Baidu stock surges after announcement of ChatGPT-style AI bot
summary: Baidu's stock surged after the company announced its intention to launch a ChatGPT-style AI chatbot called "Wenxin Yiyan" or "ERNIE Bot" in March. This strategic move highlights the ongoing AI race among tech giants, following Google's announcement of its own chatbot, Bard, and Microsoft's significant investment in OpenAI. Baidu's ERNIE Bot is based on a language model first developed in 2019 and is currently in its third iteration.

title: Reinventing search with a new AI-powered Microsoft Bing and Edge, your copilot for the web
summary: Microsoft unveiled a new AI-powered Bing search engine and Edge browser, aiming to reinvent web search by providing more complete answers, a chat experience, and content generation capabilities. These new tools are designed to act as an "AI copilot for the web," leveraging a next-generation OpenAI model (more powerful than ChatGPT) and Microsoft's proprietary Prometheus model. The update applies AI to the core search algorithm, resulting in a new user experience that integrates search, browsing, and chat.

title: C3 AI CEO on ChatGPT-Fueled Stock Jump
summary: C3.ai Inc. CEO Tom Siebel discusses the company's stock surge, which nearly doubled after the release of ChatGPT and C3.ai's new generative AI enterprise search product. Siebel highlights how generative AI will fundamentally change enterprise applications and simplify data analytics for customers, making C3.ai's offerings more accessible. Despite investor excitement, Siebel emphasizes the focus on product development and anticipates the company will become cash positive and profitable within five quarters on an adjusted basis, with plans to increase employment.

title: 3 Things to Know as NANC ETF, KRUZ ETF Start Trading
summary: The Unusual Whales Subversive Democratic Trading ETF (NANC) and the Unusual Whales Subversive Republican Trading ETF (KRUZ) have begun trading, allowing investors to track stock disclosures from members of each political party. The NANC ETF leans towards technology giants, reflecting a focus on future growth, while the KRUZ ETF is more concentrated in the energy sector, aligning with pragmatic conservatism. These ETFs provide a unique way for investors to engage with the financial activities of policymakers.

title: Beware The Passive ETF Unwind
summary: This article discusses the potential for Asia and emerging markets to outperform American equities in 2023, driven by China's reopening and attractive valuations. It highlights the challenging valuations in India in the near term but emphasizes its long-term domestic demand story. The author also warns of a potential unwind of passive ETF investment strategies in the US stock market and discusses the implications of a possible Fed U-turn.

title: Navigate 2023 With Recession-Resistant ETF ZECP
summary: The Zacks Earnings Consistent Portfolio ETF (ZECP) is presented as a recession-resistant strategy for investors concerned about a potential economic downturn in 2023. ZECP, Zacks Investment Management's first ETF, identifies companies with strong balance sheets and consistent earnings, having demonstrated resilience through past recessions. The fund seeks to offer an active approach to navigate market volatility, focusing on quality companies with stable historic and forecasted earnings per share.

title: Brazil's Zenvia Inc. Brings ChatGPT To Brand Messaging Solutions 02/14/2023
summary: Zenvia, a Brazilian cloud-based customer experience software company, has integrated OpenAI's ChatGPT into its mass texting service, Zenvia Attraction. This aims to personalize customer relations for its 14,000 clients by providing assertive message suggestions across various messaging channels. The move follows similar integrations by other tech giants, and Zenvia hopes it will enhance communication campaigns and drive sales.

title: Microsoft simplifies global employee expense management with Dynamics 365 Finance
summary: Microsoft's Finance Management team centralized and standardized its global employee expense operations using Dynamics 365 Finance. The new system, MyExpense, has streamlined processes, reduced costs, and ensured compliance with regulations like the Sarbanes-Oxley Act for Microsoft's 180,000 employees across 120 countries. This initiative has significantly improved efficiency, saving an estimated $50 million annually in employee time previously spent on expense reporting.

title: JSR
summary: JSR Corporation and IBM are collaborating to revolutionize semiconductor manufacturing by leveraging quantum computing for photoresist development. This partnership aims to overcome the increasing complexity of traditional methods for creating the materials essential to microchip production, prolonging Moore's Law. By simulating complex chemical interactions with quantum computers, JSR seeks to accelerate the development of new photoresists, making chip manufacturing faster and more cost-effective.

title: VIGI ETF Has A Quality Portfolio But We Prefer Other Alternatives (NASDAQ:VIGI)
summary: The Vanguard International Dividend Appreciation ETF (VIGI) focuses on large-cap international dividend growth stocks, excluding U.S. companies. While it holds a quality portfolio, its long-term growth potential may be inferior to U.S. peers and it carries more downside risk. The fund's price also shows an inverse correlation to the U.S. dollar index.

title: Qualcomm announces subscription cloud software service to streamline its chips supply chain
summary: Qualcomm is launching a new paid cloud software service called "Qualcomm Aware" to help companies track goods throughout their supply chains using Qualcomm chips in tracking devices. This service allows customers to program chips remotely and integrate data with other cloud platforms like Microsoft's Dynamics 365, aiming to generate additional revenue beyond chip sales. The company has already shipped hundreds of millions of these low-cost chips, typically less than $10 each, for use in various tracking applications.

title: Ansys Inc. stock rises Wednesday, outperforms market
summary: Ansys Inc. (ANSS) stock increased by 0.36% on Wednesday, closing at $266.78, despite a broader market decline where the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average both fell. This rise ended a three-day losing streak for the company's shares. Ansys outperformed competitors like Microsoft Corp. and International Business Machines Corp., and its trading volume also exceeded its 50-day average.

title: Baidu's ChatGPT-like app will revolutionise its search engine, says CEO
summary: Baidu's CEO Robin Li announced that its upcoming ChatGPT-like app, Ernie Bot, will revolutionize its search engine by enhancing user experience and engagement, significantly expanding the market size of search engines. The company plans to build an AI ecosystem around Ernie Bot, leveraging its advanced generative AI technology to boost online advertising and serve as a productivity tool for other businesses. Baidu aims to regain market share and capitalize on its "first mover" advantage in China's AI market with Ernie Bot, which is trained on years of search data and is "state of the art" in understanding Chinese language and culture.

title: Cisco works with Mercedes-Benz to create mobile office
summary: Cisco is partnering with Mercedes-Benz to integrate its Webex conferencing tools directly into the dashboards of the 2024 E-Class vehicles, transforming cars into mobile offices. While driving, users are limited to audio, but when parked, they can access all Webex features including video meetings, content sharing, and automatic transcription. This move allows Cisco to expand its collaboration tools into new markets, following a boost in video-conferencing platforms during the pandemic.

title: iShares U.S. Tech Independence Focused ETF Holdings List (BATS:IETC)
summary: This article provides a comprehensive list of the top holdings for the iShares U.S. Tech Independence Focused ETF (IETC) as of February 28, 2023. It details the company, current price, weight, and shares held for each of the top 25 companies, alongside breakdowns of geographic, currency, sector, industry, and sub-industry exposures. The ETF is heavily weighted towards technology, software, and semiconductor companies.

title: 3 Investments That Will Always Pay Off for Your Company
summary: This article argues that despite economic upheaval, companies should always invest in their people, technology, and communities as these investments consistently yield positive returns. It highlights how engaged employees lead to higher profits, digital tools enhance efficiency and customer experience, and community involvement attracts talent and strengthens business relationships. These strategies are presented as crucial for resilience and sustainable growth in any economic climate.

title: Artificial Intelligence ETFs, or ETFs Powered by Artificial Intelligence?
summary: This article differentiates between Artificial Intelligence ETFs that invest in companies benefiting from AI technologies and ETFs that use AI as a method for stock selection. It highlights examples of both types of ETFs, their performance, and discusses the role of AI in investment processes as augmentation rather than replacement.

title: Gartner Predicts Three Ways Autonomous Technologies Will Impact the FP&A and Controller Functions in Finance
summary: Gartner predicts three ways autonomous technologies will impact FP&A and controllership functions by 2028, urging finance leaders to plan for these changes. Key predictions include increased use of data-lineage technologies, automation of descriptive and diagnostic analytics, and replacement of bottom-up forecasting with AI. These developments aim to improve data quality, transparency, and business performance by minimizing the burden of data analysis.

title: Elliott nominates slate of directors to Salesforce board - source
summary: Activist investor Elliott Management Corp has nominated a slate of directors to the board of Salesforce Inc, following their multi-billion dollar stake acquisition in January. Elliott praised Salesforce's recent announcements, including accelerated margin targets and a $20 billion share repurchase, as steps toward regaining investor trust. This move adds pressure on Salesforce to deliver on promises and enhance accountability through board oversight.

title: C3 AI Announces Fiscal Third Quarter 2023 Financial Results
summary: C3 AI (NYSE: AI) announced strong financial results for its fiscal third quarter ended January 31, 2023, exceeding revenue guidance with $66.7 million. The company highlighted successful partnerships, expansion into new markets, and a confident outlook towards profitability in FY24, driven by its consumption-based pricing model and innovations in enterprise AI and Generative AI.

title: Lidiane Jones, Slack’s new CEO, is the glue between it and Salesforce
summary: Lidiane Jones, the new CEO of Slack, is highlighted as the crucial link bridging Slack and Salesforce, especially after the departures of key executives including Slack cofounder Stewart Butterfield and Salesforce co-CEO Bret Taylor. The article discusses the challenges and opportunities Jones faces in integrating Slack with Salesforce, emphasizing her unique background and vision for Slack as the core engagement layer for all Salesforce products amidst competitive pressure from Microsoft Teams and Wall Street scrutiny of the acquisition's value. Her role is seen as vital for the future success and synergistic operation of the two companies.

title: VT vs ACWI ETF: Which is the Best World ETF?
summary: This article compares two popular World ETFs, Vanguard's Total World Stock Index Fund ETF (VT) and iShares' MSCI ACWI ETF (ACWI), to help investors decide which is best for their portfolio. It delves into their differences in expense ratios, underlying indices, geographical breakdown, number of constituents, dividend yields, and fund managers, as well as their similarities in strategy, purpose, returns, liquidity, and sector breakdown. The author concludes that VT offers a lower expense ratio and exposure to smaller-cap companies, which might appeal to investors seeking that longer-tail exposure.

title: 10 Undervalued, High-Quality Stocks With Competitive Advantages
summary: This article identifies 10 undervalued, high-quality stocks with wide economic moats, according to Morningstar analysts. These companies, including Adobe, Microsoft, and Alphabet, have strong balance sheets, high profitability, and competitive advantages expected to last over 20 years. The stocks listed were trading below their fair value estimates as of March 2, 2023.

title: Growth stock vs. value stock? It's all in the eye of the beholder
summary: The article discusses the increasingly blurred lines between growth and value stocks, particularly in the context of index investing. It highlights how major index providers like S&P reclassify stocks such as Microsoft and ExxonMobil, challenging traditional definitions due to factors like price momentum and earnings changes. The piece emphasizes that different index construction methodologies and rebalancing schedules can lead to significant performance divergences among growth and value ETFs, urging investors to understand what criteria their investments are based on.

title: Einstein AI was good, but Salesforce claims Einstein GPT is even better
summary: Salesforce announced a new partnership with OpenAI and launched its Einstein GPT generative AI service, aiming to enhance CRM, marketing, and sales processes. Einstein GPT integrates proprietary AI models with external generative AI, initially with OpenAI, to automate content generation and improve customer experience. The company also introduced a $250 million fund through Salesforce Ventures to support the generative AI startup ecosystem.

title: Salesforce follows Microsoft in launching A.I. tools for salespeople with help from OpenAI
summary: Salesforce is launching new AI-powered tools, including Einstein GPT for sales and service and a ChatGPT app for Slack, leveraging OpenAI's technology. These tools aim to assist salespeople, customer service agents, and marketers by generating responses and content, with an emphasis on human review to mitigate the spread of incorrect information. This move follows Microsoft's similar integration of AI into its business software, highlighting the competitive rush among tech giants to capitalize on generative AI.

title: SAP Introduces SAP Datasphere to Simplify Customers’ Data Landscape – Partners with Collibra, Confluent, Databricks and DataRobot
summary: SAP announced SAP Datasphere, the next generation of its data management portfolio, designed to simplify customers' data landscapes and provide easy access to business-ready data. SAP is partnering with industry-leading data and AI companies—Collibra NV, Confluent Inc., Databricks Inc., and DataRobot Inc.—to enrich SAP Datasphere, allowing organizations to create a unified data architecture combining SAP and non-SAP data. This initiative aims to eliminate hidden "data tax" and enable faster, more informed business decision-making by preserving business context and logic within data.

title: State wants to hear from people who lost power in storms
summary: Michigan state regulators are holding town hall meetings to hear from residents who lost power during recent storms across the Lower Peninsula. The Michigan Public Service Commission (MPSC) announced two in-person meetings in Jackson and Dearborn on March 20, and a livestreamed event on March 21. MPSC Chairman Dan Scripps expressed shared frustration with power grid reliability and encouraged residents to share their experiences.

title: The accelerating rise of automation: 5 top jobs that will be replaced by AI
summary: This article discusses the accelerating rise of automation and artificial intelligence, identifying five top jobs that are likely to be replaced by AI. It explores expert opinions and studies on the impact of AI on the job market and specific degrees at risk, while emphasizing that the full extent of AI's impact on employment is still uncertain.

title: PETRONAS
summary: PETRONAS, a global oil and gas company, partnered with IBM Consulting to develop the UP app, accelerating project completion by up to four times. This digital solution provides decision-makers with fast access to curated upstream data, enhancing operational efficiency and decision-making within the company. The UP platform, built using agile methodologies on Microsoft Azure, now serves over 30,000 users and features more than 100 diverse functionalities, significantly impacting PETRONAS's digital transformation.

title: 무위험지표금리 ETF 인기에 미국판 출격 대기
summary: 한국의 무위험지표금리(KOFR) 추종 ETF가 큰 인기를 얻자, 국내 자산운용사 4곳이 미국의 무위험지표금리(SOFR)를 추종하는 ETF 상장을 준비 중이다. 이 SOFR ETF는 달러를 보유한 기관 및 개인 투자자들이 은행 파킹통장처럼 활용할 수 있으며, 이르면 다음 달 삼성자산운용이 첫 상품을 출시할 예정이다. 투자자들은 KOFR ETF의 성공에 이어 SOFR ETF도 안정적인 달러 운용처로서 주목할 것으로 예상된다.

title: Morgan Stanley partners with OpenAI on internal chatbot for its advisors
summary: Morgan Stanley is partnering with OpenAI to create an internal-facing chatbot for its financial advisors, leveraging OpenAI's latest GPT-4 technology. This chatbot will provide advisors with instant, accurate answers generated exclusively from Morgan Stanley's proprietary content library, aiming to enhance efficiency and client service. This initiative is part of the firm's broader exploration into AI-powered tools, though Morgan Stanley emphasizes that human advice and advisor-client relationships will remain central to its wealth management strategy.

title: SAP Introduces SAP Datasphere to Simplify Customers’ Data Landscape
summary: SAP announced SAP Datasphere, the next generation of its data management portfolio, designed to simplify customers’ data landscapes and provide easy access to business-ready data. The company also unveiled strategic partnerships with Confluent, Databricks, Collibra, and DataRobot to enrich SAP Datasphere, enabling organizations to create unified architectures combining SAP and non-SAP data. This initiative aims to eliminate the complexity and "hidden data tax" associated with integrating disparate data sources, empowering customers with faster insights and improved decision-making.

title: Global Corporations Join Brookfield to Invest Nearly a Billion Dollars in Closed Loop Partners' Operating Company, Circular Services, the Leading Developer of Circular Economy Infrastructure
summary: Closed Loop Partners announced that six major corporations – Microsoft, Nestlé, PepsiCo, SK Group, Starbucks, and Unilever – are joining Brookfield to invest nearly a billion dollars in Circular Services. This investment aims to scale circular economy infrastructure and services in the United States, focusing on packaging, organics, textiles, and electronics. Circular Services, already the largest privately held recycling company in the U.S., will use these funds to upgrade recycling capabilities and prevent billions in landfill disposal costs, fostering a transition to a circular economy.

title: The 3 Best Cloud Computing ETFs to Buy for Long-Term Growth
summary: This article recommends three cloud computing ETFs for long-term growth, citing McKinsey's prediction of a $3 trillion EBITDA increase by 2030 from cloud adoption. It details the First Trust Cloud Computing ETF (SKYY), WisdomTree Cloud Computing Fund (WCLD), and ARK Next Generation Internet ETF (ARKW), highlighting their management styles, holdings, and performance. The author emphasizes diversification over single-company bets like Microsoft for cloud investing.

title: Microsoft recognized as a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Data Security Platforms, Q1 2023
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Data Security Platforms, Q1 2023 report, highlighting its strong capabilities in data classification, threat visibility, and privacy solutions. The company's comprehensive Microsoft Purview suite and integrated ecosystem are lauded for their ability to help organizations protect sensitive data and mitigate risks. This recognition underscores Microsoft's significant investments in data security, reinforced by positive feedback from customers.

title: Digital Economy Discovers a Potential Frontier for Growth Thanks to Generative AI
summary: Generative AI, exemplified by large language models like GPT-3, is revolutionizing artificial intelligence, offering significant leaps in capabilities, speed, and cost-effectiveness. This new wave of AI is poised to drive massive innovation, boosting productivity and creating new applications across various sectors. The article explores how this technology will particularly impact and create opportunities in cloud computing, cybersecurity, and digital media, leading to substantial investment and growth in these areas.

title: Procter & Gamble confirm breach
summary: Procter & Gamble confirmed that one of its companies was affected by the Fortra GoAnywhere vulnerability, leading to a breach where attackers obtained some employee information. The company stated that no sensitive data like social security numbers, credit card details, or customer data was compromised, and business operations continue normally. The Russia-linked Cl0p ransomware syndicate, which claimed responsibility, has victimized numerous organizations using this zero-day flaw.

title: Do AI-powered ETFs outperform their human-managed rivals?
summary: This article investigates whether AI-powered ETFs outperform human-managed rivals, exploring their advantages like advanced risk management and data analysis, as well as their drawbacks such as algorithmic complexity. It highlights the performance of the AI-Powered Equity ETF (AIEQ) and references studies with mixed but promising conclusions on AI's effectiveness in active portfolio management. The piece concludes that while AI-powered ETFs offer significant benefits, their long-term performance remains to be definitively proven.

title: Top and Flop ETFs of March
summary: The U.S. stock market experienced extreme volatility in March, characterized by bank failures and a tech-driven rally. This article highlights the top and flop ETFs of the month, with technology and gold-related funds performing well, while regional bank and natural gas ETFs saw declines.

title: iShares MSCI USA Quality Factor ETF (QUAL) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the iShares MSCI USA Quality Factor ETF (QUAL), including its stock price, key statistics, top holdings, dividend data, and historical performance. As of the latest N-PORT filing on 2025-07-31, QUAL holds 125 stocks with NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple as its top positions. The ETF has a current dividend yield of 0.94% and a P/E ratio of 26.81.

title: ProShares Ultra QQQ 2x Shares (QLD) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of ProShares Ultra QQQ 2x Shares (QLD), including its stock price, key statistics, top holdings, and dividend information. It highlights QLD's current portfolio value of $6.70 billion with top holdings like NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple, and details its performance and historical data. The article also lists recent trades and key fundamental data.

title: China AI: What Lies Ahead?
summary: A Citi Research report by Alicia Yap examines the AI landscape in China, forecasting significant growth in its generative AI application market from Rmb66.3bn in 2022 to Rmb207bn by 2025. The report also highlights the rapid expansion of China's cybersecurity market, projected to reach US$31.9bn by 2026, driven by digital economy demands and government support. It discusses how generative AI could revolutionize the SaaS industry and considers the impact of data privacy and censorship on China's AI progress.

title: iShares Global 100 ETF (IOO) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of the iShares Global 100 ETF (IOO), detailing its stock price, current holdings, and dividend yield. As of its latest N-PORT filing on September 30, 2025, IOO primarily invests in major tech companies like NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, and Broadcom. The ETF manages $7.30 billion in common equities with a 0% turnover rate, offering key statistics and historical performance data.

title: Ibex Global Solutions closing San Antonio call center, affecting 227 employees
summary: Ibex Global Solutions is closing its San Antonio call center in June, impacting 227 employees. Most workers will be offered positions at the company's New Braunfels call center or the option to work from home. This closure is part of a larger trend of layoffs in the region, with Ibex shifting operations to offshore and nearshore locations.

title: Chegg announces CheggMate, the new AI companion, built with GPT-4
summary: Chegg, Inc. announced CheggMate, a new AI-enhanced learning service built with OpenAI’s GPT-4, designed to provide personalized and interactive learning experiences for students. CheggMate will leverage Chegg's proprietary data and GPT-4's problem-solving capabilities to offer features like tailored quizzes, guided support, and recommendations. Early access for students is expected in May 2023.

title: Problems at Hercules Capital (HTGC)
summary: The Bear Cave challenges Hercules Capital's perceived strength, alleging that its robust financial appearance is a "mirage." The report highlights concerning portfolio marks, severe distress in portfolio companies, and significant stock declines in its past successful investments. Despite management's optimistic outlook and analyst endorsements, the article raises questions about the true health of Hercules Capital's $2.8 billion loan portfolio.

title: 2 Invesco ETFs That Offer Meta Exposure
summary: As Meta Platforms Inc. shares surge, two Invesco ETFs—the Invesco NASDAQ Internet ETF (PNQI) and the Invesco Dynamic Media ETF (PBS)—offer significant exposure to the company. Meta is the top holding in both ETFs, with weights of 9.1% and 6.6% respectively. Investors looking to capitalize on Meta's strong performance and broader internet or media sectors may consider these funds.

title: Trimble partners with Microsoft to take on construction’s biggest challenges
summary: Trimble has partnered with Microsoft to develop Trimble Construction Cloud, built on Microsoft Azure, to address the construction industry's monumental challenges, including labor shortages and sustainability goals. This strategic alliance aims to connect disparate systems and data, facilitating digital transformation across construction, agriculture, and transportation. The cloud solution leverages Azure services to enable real-time collaboration, automate workflows, and integrate various technologies, aiming to improve productivity and decision-making for customers.

title: Survey Signals Pause-and-Pivot Year for CEOs
summary: The 2023 Gartner CEO and Senior Business Executive Survey indicates a shift from short-term reactivity to cautious long-term planning, with CEOs focusing on business productivity and new three- to seven-year growth strategies. While growth remains a top priority, profitability is investors' primary concern, leading to an emphasis on multiyear productivity engineering and the creative application of new technologies like AI and automation. Talent and workforce issues, including shortages and compensation demands, continue to be significant challenges for executives.

title: IBM to pause hiring for certain jobs that could be replaced by AI
summary: IBM's CEO, Arvind Krishna, announced that the company will slow down or potentially suspend hiring for non-customer-facing roles, such as human resources, anticipating that AI and automation could replace about 30% of these jobs within five years. Despite this, IBM is actively hiring for revenue-generating and client-facing positions, asserting there is "no blanket hiring ‘pause’ in place." Krishna expects AI to replace many clerical white-collar jobs but believes the net increase in jobs related to AI development will be positive.

title: Msci Kld 400 Social Index: Meaning, Example, FAQs
summary: The MSCI KLD 400 Social Index is a market capitalization-weighted stock index that focuses on large, mid, and small-cap U.S. companies with high environmental, social, and governance (ESG) standards, excluding certain industries. Founded as the Domini 400 Social Index, it was a pioneer in socially responsible investing. The index is reviewed quarterly and tends to be dominated by large American technology companies like Microsoft, NVIDIA, Alphabet, Tesla, and Visa.

title: Edgewell moves to SAP on Azure, strengthening BCDR and innovation on the Microsoft Cloud
summary: Edgewell Personal Care successfully migrated its entire SAP estate to SAP on Azure, enhancing business continuity, disaster recovery, and fostering innovation. This move, supported by Khoj Information Technology, Inc., allowed Edgewell to improve agility, reduce costs, and focus on strategic initiatives rather than datacenter management. The migration significantly boosted system availability and provided greater flexibility for scaling workloads and integrating diverse systems.

title: 40 Under 40: Champions of Construction 2022
summary: This article celebrates Autodesk's 40 Under 40: Champions of Construction for 2022, highlighting 40 individuals who are making significant contributions to the construction industry through innovation, leadership, and digital transformation. It details their roles, achievements, and impact on their respective companies and the broader AEC sector. The honorees are recognized for advancing digital maturity, implementing new technologies, and fostering collaborative and sustainable practices.

title: Amkor Technology seeks to open Vietnam factory in fourth quarter
summary: U.S.-based Amkor Technology Inc. expects its mega facility in Bac Ninh, Vietnam, to begin first-phase manufacturing in the fourth quarter of this year. This factory, covering 1.9 million square feet, will be among Amkor's largest globally and represents a $1.6 billion investment until 2035. The move highlights Vietnam's growing importance as a manufacturing and R&D hub for major foreign electronics manufacturers.

title: Cisco Business Model
summary: This article details Cisco's business model, which has evolved from primarily selling networking hardware to offering high-technology services and software. It covers the company's financial performance, revenue streams from hardware sales, licensing, and services, and strategic initiatives like acquisitions. The article also provides a SWOT analysis, outlines key competitors, and discusses Cisco's customer segments and value propositions.

title: Big Names Provide Ballast for Blockchain Technology
summary: Digital Asset, in partnership with over 30 companies, has launched the Canton Network, the financial services industry’s first privacy-enabled blockchain for institutional assets. This initiative, which includes firms held by the Invesco Alerian Galaxy Blockchain Users and Decentralized Commerce ETF (BLKC), addresses key blockchain issues like privacy and scalability, affirming the technology's long-term investment viability. The Canton Network enables atomic transactions for digital assets and payments, enhancing efficiency and reducing operational risk in financial services.

title: Here's how AI is driving the rise of GPU cloud specialists
summary: The rise of AI is fueling a new class of cloud providers specializing in GPU compute, offering lower prices than generalized cloud competitors. Companies like CoreWeave, Lambda Labs, RunPod, and Arc Compute are catering to AI workloads that require substantial GPU resources. These niche providers differentiate themselves through competitive pricing, strategic locations, and ready access to scarce compute resources amidst supply chain challenges.

title: Top 15 Coursera Competitors and Alternatives
summary: This article provides an in-depth analysis of Coursera's top 15 competitors and alternatives in the online learning market. It details each competitor's background, offerings, unique selling propositions, and how they differentiate themselves from Coursera, covering a wide range of platforms from tech-focused learning to creative arts and general education.

title: TCHP Outshines iShares S&P 500 Growth Fund
summary: The T. Rowe Price Blue Chip Growth ETF (TCHP) has significantly outperformed the iShares S&P 500 Growth ETF (IVW) year-to-date as of May 10, demonstrating the effectiveness of active management. TCHP's concentrated approach and focus on blue-chip companies with strong fundamentals, including significant stakes in companies like Microsoft and Meta, contribute to its strong performance. This highlights the potential for active ETFs to generate alpha, especially in volatile markets, when managed by experienced teams with robust research capabilities.

title: FTC Sues to Block Amgen’s Acquisition of Horizon Therapeutics
summary: The FTC is suing to block Amgen's $27.8 billion acquisition of Horizon Therapeutics, citing concerns that it could create a monopoly in the market for critical thyroid eye disease and chronic refractory gout treatments. The agency believes Amgen could leverage its existing drug portfolio to pressure healthcare providers and insurers into favoring Horizon's drugs, Tepezza and Krystexxa, which currently face no market competition. Amgen has expressed disappointment but remains committed to completing the acquisition, asserting it will benefit patients with rare diseases.

title: Land O'Lakes says US carbon farming payouts top $5 million in 2022
summary: Land O'Lakes' Truterra unit paid U.S. farmers $5.1 million in 2022 for sequestering 262,000 metric tons of carbon, an increase from $4 million in 2021. This program is part of a growing trend among agricultural companies like Corteva and Bayer to capitalize on demand for environmental credits by promoting sustainable farming practices. Microsoft Corp is a major buyer of Truterra's carbon removal credits.

title: Roundhill Launches Generative AI & Technology ETF With CHAT
summary: Roundhill Investments has launched the Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF (CHAT), an actively managed ETF focusing on global companies leading in generative AI technology. The fund aims to offer precise exposure to generative AI, distinguishing itself from other AI-themed ETFs that may lack such specific focus. Top holdings include Nvidia, Microsoft, and Alphabet, with expectations for the basket to expand as more companies genuinely contribute to the generative AI space.

title: Roundhill Investments Launches Generative AI & Technology ETF (NYSE Arca: CHAT)
summary: Roundhill Investments has launched the Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF (NYSE Arca: CHAT), providing investors with exposure to companies at the forefront of generative AI technology. The ETF aims to capitalize on the rapidly growing generative AI market, which Roundhill estimates to have a total addressable market of over $120 billion for enterprise software. CHAT is an actively-managed ETF with top holdings including Nvidia, Microsoft, Alphabet, and Salesforce, offering investors a way to participate in this innovative and transformative technology.

title: Steve Jobs: Apple Cofounder and Tech Innovator
summary: Steve Jobs, co-founder of Apple Inc., was an American inventor, designer, and entrepreneur responsible for pioneering revolutionary technologies like the iPhone and iPad. The article details his life from adoption and early education to co-founding Apple, his departure and subsequent ventures with NeXT and Pixar, and his triumphant return to Apple, ultimately shaping modern technology. It also covers his personal life, battle with pancreatic cancer, and lasting legacy after his death in 2011.

title: Is BULZ Stock a buy?
summary: The article discusses BULZ, the ticker symbol for the MicroSectors FANG & Innovation 3X Leveraged ETNs, which trades on NYSE Arca. It explains that BULZ is an unsecured debt security providing leveraged exposure to the Solactive FANG Innovation Index, tracking 15 large-cap US tech stocks, and is not suitable for "buy and hold" investments. The article also mentions Bank of Montreal as the issuer and highlights Barclays' recent decision to redeem some of its own ETNs due to past issues, noting this does not directly impact BULZ but provides context on the ETN market.

title: NVIDIA Collaborates With Microsoft to Accelerate Enterprise-Ready Generative AI
