title: Microsoft Stock 'Still In The Lead In The AI Revolution': Analyst Expects 'Robust' Q2 Results
summary: Wedbush analyst Dan Ives has maintained an Outperform rating on Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) with a $625 price target, anticipating robust Q2 results driven by Azure's growth and the company's lead in the AI revolution. Ives believes the market is underestimating Azure's AI-driven growth trajectory and positions Microsoft as a compelling large-cap tech stock. Despite increased competition and concerns about its OpenAI relationship, Microsoft is expected to continue heavy spending on AI buildout, solidifying its front-runner position in enterprise hyper-scale AI.

title: Microsoft heads into Q2 earnings with cloud strength, AI spending in focus (MSFT:NASDAQ)
summary: Microsoft (MSFT) is scheduled to report its Q2 earnings on January 28, with analysts anticipating strong cloud and enterprise demand to drive solid results. Wall Street projects EPS of $3.92 and revenue of $80.28B, a 15.3% year-over-year increase. Key focuses for investors will be the impact of cloud performance and returns on AI investments, juxtaposed against concerns over increasing capital expenditures and potential profitability headwinds.

title: Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) Trading Up 2.2% After Analyst Upgrade
summary: Microsoft shares rose 2.2% after BNP Paribas Exane upgraded its price target to $659 with an outperform rating. The company is experiencing positive catalysts from its new Maia 200 AI chip and approval for 15 new data centers in Wisconsin, enhancing its Azure/Copilot capabilities. Despite some insider selling, Microsoft maintains a consensus "Buy" rating from analysts with an average target of $612.58, although some analysts express concerns about near-term margin pressure and environmental risks from AI investments.

title: Microsoft Continues to Spend Big on A.I. While Profit Jumps 60 Percent
summary: Microsoft announced a significant increase in profit, up 60% to $38.5 billion, and revenue of $81.3 billion for its latest quarter, exceeding Wall Street expectations. The company continues to heavily invest in AI infrastructure, spending $37.5 billion on data centers, a 65% increase year-over-year. Despite these strong financial results, Microsoft's shares dropped over 5% in after-hours trading.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) Q2 FY26 earnings results beat revenue and EPS expectations
summary: Microsoft (MSFT) announced its Q2 FY26 earnings, significantly surpassing Wall Street's expectations for both revenue and EPS. The company reported $81.3 billion in revenue against an $80.16 billion consensus, and an EPS of $4.14 compared to estimates of $3.88. Microsoft's continued growth is attributed to its heavy investments in AI technology, despite a slight dip in stock performance in after-hours trading.

title: Washington Trust Bank Purchases 12,159 Shares of Microsoft Corporation $MSFT
summary: Washington Trust Bank increased its stake in Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) by 8.4% in the third quarter, purchasing an additional 12,159 shares, making Microsoft its largest holding at 5.9% of its portfolio, valued at over $81 million. Microsoft, a software giant with a $3.2 trillion market cap, reported strong quarterly earnings, beating analyst estimates with $4.14 EPS and $81.27 billion in revenue, and declared a quarterly dividend of $0.91 per share. Despite some recent insider selling and mixed market sentiment regarding AI investments and Azure growth, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with a target price of $597.73.

title: RBC Capital Reiterates Outperform Rating on Microsoft Corporation (MSFT)
summary: RBC Capital has reaffirmed its Outperform rating for Microsoft Corporation (MSFT), setting a share price target of $640. The firm highlighted Microsoft's strong quarterly results, with revenues, earnings, and operating margins exceeding estimates, and noted the company's effective leveraging of AI for continued growth. Analysts maintain Microsoft as their top large-cap pick, seeing its AI footprint and cloud growth as underestimated.

title: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT)’s Capital Expenditures Soar, Cloud Revenue Falls Short of Expectations, and Shares Plummet After Hours
summary: Microsoft (MSFT) shares dropped 6.5% in after-hours trading following the announcement of massive capital expenditures, particularly in AI, and cloud revenue that slightly missed expectations. Despite a 39% surge in Azure sales and a 17% overall revenue increase, a 66% year-on-year rise in capital spending to $37.5 billion, mainly for computing chips, and looming competition from rivals like Google's Gemini, spooked investors. The company projects continued Azure growth and revealed M365 Copilot has 15 million annual users, with a cloud backlog doubled to $625 billion, 45% attributed to OpenAI.

title: ‘Down but Not Out’: Morgan Stanley Sees 50% Upside for Microsoft Stock After Selloff
summary: Following a significant selloff caused by concerns over AI infrastructure spending, Morgan Stanley analyst Keith Weiss maintains an Overweight (Buy) rating on Microsoft (MSFT) stock, projecting a 51% upside potential. Despite slower-than-expected cloud growth, Microsoft's strong Q2 FY26 revenue and commercial bookings, including major deals with OpenAI and Anthropic, suggest durable demand and potential for margin expansion. Weiss believes the recent pullback offers an attractive entry point for investors.

title: Inside Microsoft's AI partner ecosystem: ISG evaluates 320 firms
summary: Information Services Group (ISG) has initiated a research study to evaluate service providers assisting enterprises in leveraging Microsoft's AI-embedded platforms. The study will culminate in a series of ISG Provider Lens® reports, "Microsoft AI and Cloud Ecosystem," set for release in July 2026. These reports aim to guide enterprises in vendor selection for AI and cloud solutions, covering productivity services, data transformation, AI services, and managed services built on Microsoft technologies.

title: Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) Trading Down 2.9% - Here's Why
summary: Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) shares fell 2.9% after its earnings report highlighted significant AI capital expenditures and a slowdown in cloud revenue growth, leading to analyst price target cuts. Despite this, the company exceeded EPS and revenue estimates, launched a new AI chip, and expanded its AI/cloud offerings, maintaining a "Moderate Buy" consensus from analysts. Geopolitical risks and insider selling also contributed to the negative sentiment.

title: Updates in two of our core priorities
summary: Satya Nadella announced significant leadership changes at Microsoft, reinforcing the company's focus on security and quality. Hayete Gallot is rejoining Microsoft as Executive Vice President, Security, reporting directly to Nadella. Charlie Bell will transition to a new role focused on engineering quality, also reporting to Nadella, leveraging his expertise to enhance product durability and user experience.

title: Microsoft’s AI product Copilot faces issues, competition: report
summary: Microsoft's AI chatbot, Copilot, is struggling with user adoption and competition from ChatGPT and Google's Gemini, according to a report. Users cite confusing branding and interoperability issues, leading to a preference for rival AI products. Microsoft is responding by increasing investment in advertising, training, and cloud computing power to improve Copilot's integration and market perception.

title: Stifel downgrades Microsoft stock to Hold on Azure concerns
summary: Stifel downgraded Microsoft stock from Buy to Hold and significantly cut its price target due to concerns over Azure's supply constraints and increased AI competition. The firm believes Wall Street's 2027 revenue and earnings expectations are too optimistic, citing strong performance from Google Cloud Platform and Anthropic. Stifel also raised its capital expenditure estimate for Microsoft and lowered its gross margin forecast, indicating a new spending phase for AI development.

title: Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) Trading Down 5% After Analyst Downgrade
summary: Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) shares dropped 5% after Daiwa Capital Markets lowered its price target and Stifel issued a rare downgrade, citing increased AI competition and pressure on Azure growth. Despite multiple price target trims and investor concerns regarding rising AI capital expenditure and Copilot adoption, analysts largely maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a consensus price target of $593.28. The company recently beat Q2 earnings estimates and announced a quarterly dividend, but ongoing challenges in the cloud sector and AI monetization are impacting investor sentiment.

title: Lawmakers debate data center guardrails, Microsoft aims to be ‘good neighbor’
summary: Disagreement is emerging among Wisconsin lawmakers regarding the speed at which data centers should be regulated, particularly as Microsoft rapidly expands its operations in the state. While some legislators advocate for immediate guardrails, others prefer a "wait-don't-regulate" approach. Microsoft, investing billions, emphasizes its commitment to being a "good neighbor" through sustainability, community investments, and job training initiatives.

title: Microsoft's free cash flow considered 'most resilient' of hyperscalers: BNP Paribas
summary: BNP Paribas has identified Microsoft's free cash flow as the most resilient among major hyperscalers. This comes as the top five hyperscalers are projected to spend nearly $700 billion in capital expenditure this year, a significant increase from previous estimates.

title: Trinity Street Asset Management LLP Sells 9,617 Shares of Microsoft Corporation $MSFT
summary: Trinity Street Asset Management LLP reduced its stake in Microsoft Corporation by 10.9% in the third quarter, selling 9,617 shares and holding 78,840 shares valued at $40.84 million. Despite this, Microsoft remains the firm's seventh-largest holding, accounting for 2.8% of its portfolio. The article also notes other institutional investor activities, analyst ratings, and recent insider selling by Microsoft executives.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) Has a Lot of Firepower, Says Jim Cramer
summary: Jim Cramer discussed Microsoft's unexpected downgrade following its fiscal third-quarter earnings despite beating analyst estimates. He acknowledged Stifel's concerns about Azure's competition and supply constraints but reiterated Microsoft's significant "firepower." Cramer also humorously compared Google's Cloud head to Lebron James in the competitive cloud market.

title: Barclays Remains Bullish on Microsoft Corporation (MSFT)
summary: Barclays has reiterated a Buy rating on Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) with a price target of $600. Britain is collaborating with Microsoft and experts to develop a system for detecting deepfake material online, aiming to set standards for tackling deceptive AI-generated content. While Microsoft is seen as a promising investment, the article suggests other AI stocks might offer greater upside potential with less downside risk.

title: How Noelle Walsh Drives Microsoft's Global Data Centres
summary: Noelle Walsh, President of Cloud Operations and Innovation at Microsoft, is highlighted for her pivotal role in leading Microsoft's global data centre estate. Recognizing her leadership in shaping hyperscale cloud infrastructure and embedding sustainability, she is ranked second in Data Centre Magazine’s Top 100 Data Centre Leaders. Her responsibilities include designing, building, and operating data centers critical for Azure, Microsoft 365, and AI services, while also championing environmental considerations like water efficiency.

title: Microsoft Corporation Fell 7% This Week. Here’s Where the Stock Could Be Headed in 2026
summary: Microsoft Corporation's stock fell 7% due to a broader tech sell-off, despite strong fundamentals. Institutional investors showed mixed but generally constructive activity, while Microsoft reported robust Q4 earnings driven by its Cloud segment and AI offerings. The TIKR Guided Valuation Model suggests Microsoft is undervalued, with a target price of $624, implying a 56% upside over 2.4 years, driven by AI monetization and Azure growth.

title: Microsoft Stock Rises Amid Sector Rotation and Analyst Optimism | 2026 Market Update - News and Statistics
summary: Microsoft stock increased by 3.1% after analysts suggested it was oversold following a recent sector sell-off. This rise is attributed to institutional investors returning to established companies, with Barclays noting slow corporate transitions that benefit incumbents. The stock had previously dropped 11.8% due to mixed quarterly results, and it remains down 12.5% for the year and 23.7% below its 52-week high.

title: Occidental Asset Management LLC Has $29.25 Million Holdings in Microsoft Corporation $MSFT
summary: Occidental Asset Management LLC increased its stake in Microsoft Corporation by 7.7% in the third quarter, bringing their total holdings to 56,474 shares valued at $29.25 million. Microsoft represents 3.7% of their investment portfolio. Other institutional investors like Norges Bank, Nuveen LLC, and Vanguard Group Inc. also significantly altered their positions in Microsoft.

title: Hartline Investment Corp Sells 2,339 Shares of Microsoft Corporation $MSFT
summary: Hartline Investment Corp recently decreased its stake in Microsoft Corporation by 3.4%, selling 2,339 shares and retaining 65,819 shares valued at $34.09 million. Microsoft remains Hartline's fifth-largest holding, constituting approximately 3.5% of its portfolio. The sale comes amidst mixed investor sentiment regarding Microsoft, with strong earnings and AI monetization prospects balanced by concerns over significant AI capital expenditures and some analyst downgrades despite a generally positive "Moderate Buy" rating from Wall Street.
